Ingredients:

  • Broken poori - 1 cup
  • Sev -1/2 cup
  • Potato - 2 medium sized, boiled and mashed
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Channa - 1/2 cup, boiled
  • Onion - 1/2, chopped finely
  • Tamarind sweet chutney - bought from Indian store
  • Green chutney - bought from Indian store

Directions:

In a large mixing bowl, add all the ingredients except chutneys. Toss them all well. Then add the chutney one by one, about 1 - 2 tbsp each. You can adjust the amount as per your taste. Mix gently. Serve right away.

Ingredients - for the stuffing:

  • Potato – 3 medium sized, cooked & grated
  • Ginger garlic paste – 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves – 2 tbsp, finely chopped
  • Red chili powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder – 1/4 tsp

Ingredients - For the dough:

1) Add the grated potato in a mixing bowl. Then add all other ingredients and mix well together. Then knead the dough using dough ingredients.

Broccoli Chilla / Broccoli chickpea flour pancakes

When you don't have eggs for making omlette for breakfast, chilla would be a perfect substitute. Its very simple to make and its healthy(iron rich.) I made broccoli chilla, but you could also add grated carrots, zucchini, spinach, bell pepper...

It took me 5 minutes for preparing and 5-10 minutes for making chilla.

For making broccoli chilla, you will need the following ingredients:

Ingredients:

  • Besan flour/Chickpea flour - 4 tbsp
  • Water - 1/4 to 1/2 cups
  • Broccoli - 4 florets, finely chopped
  • Onion - 3 tbsp, finely chopped(1/2 of a medium sized)
  • Tomato - 3 tbsp, finely chopped( 1 small tomato or half medium sized)
  • Green chili - 2, deseed and chopped finely
  • Red chili powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Ginger - 1 tsp, grated or finely chopped
  • Cilantro - 3 tsp, chopped
  • Salt - to taste
  • Hing - a pinch
  • Baking soda - a pinch

Directions:

Take besan flour in a mixing bowl, add chopped onion, tomato, broccoli, ginger, green chilies, red chili powder, salt, hing, baking soda and chopped cilantro and mix well using your hands.

Then add water to the bowl little at a time and keep mixing, you should get a pancake/dosa batter consistency. Beat them well and keep aside for 5 minutes.

Meanwhile heat your tawa, preferably cast iron. Once its hot pour a spoonful of chilla batter and spread in circular motion using the back of the spoon. Pour ghee/oil on the sides. Maintain the heat medium, so it'll get cooked evenly. After a minute flip to the other side and cook for 1 more minute.

Take from the tawa and serve with a blob of butter. You could also use tomato ketchup as a side.

Here's new & quick tasty breakfast meal. Its made with Quinoa - one of our recent favorites. Our two year old likes it a lot. There are various possibilities with this nutritious whole grain. Main meal, appetizer, dessert etc. What I made today, I call it the 'avacado quinoa mezcalr'! Its a healthy vegetarian breakfast meal. Give it a shot if you like couscous, sooji/rava.  

Ingredients:

1 cup quinoa 1 avocado 1/2 tomato, chopped salt 2 cups water

Directions:

Bring water to boil, add quinoa, cook for 12 minutes. Remove from heat, let it cool down. In the meanwhile mash the avocado, then add the chopped tomatoes, salt. Now add the cooked quinoa, toss them well. I served them with a hard boiled egg. There is no need for oil or any other ingredient. It tasted so good. If you love avocado as it is, then I don't think you need tomatoes(extra flavor) there. But if you want you can even add olives, herbs likes cilantro, few mint or lentils like chick pea, black beans, to make it a full meal. You could also add pepper or other spices.

For dry roast & grind:

  • Channa dal - 2 tbsp
  • Red chilies - 2
  • Coriander seeds - 1 tbsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tbsp
  • Black pepper - 1/4 tsp
  • Fenugreek seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Coconut - 3 tbsp, grated

For sambar:

  • Toor dal - 1 cup
  • Onion - 1, chopped (use 10 pearl onions instead)
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Drumstick - 1, cut into 2" pieces
  • Tamarind paste - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Hing
  • Oil/Ghee - 1 tbsp
 

Directions

Dry roast the ingredients given above. Let them cool down and grind to a fine paste.

 

Wash and cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker with 2 cups water, onion, tomato, drumstick, turmeric powder and salt. Once cooked, open the pressure cooker and mix them well.

Heat oil in a pan, do the seasoning with mustard seeds, hing and curry leaves. Add this to the cooked dal. Add the ground paste and 1/2 cup water. Cook for 5 more minutes or until the sambar starts boiling.

Arachu vitta sambar can be served with dosa/idli, uthappam.

Ingredients: For Refried beans

  • White onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Pinto beans - 2 cups
  • Garlic - 3 cloves, minced
  • Cayenne pepper - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tsp
  • Salt - to taste

Other Ingredients:

  • Broccoli - 2 cups, chopped
  • Carrot - 2, chopped
  • Bell pepper - 1 cup, chopped, use any color
  • White onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Garlic powder - 1 tbsp
  • Ground cumin - 1/2 tsp
  • Olives - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomatoes - 2, chopped
  • Salsa - 1 cup
  • Tortilla - 4, cut into 2" strips
  • Tortilla chips
  • Cheddar/Monterery jack cheese - 1 cup, shredded
  • Olive oil - 2 tbsp

Directions - For refried beans:

Soak the beans over night. Cook them in pressure cooker. Heat olive oil in a pan, saute the onion, garlic. Add the other spices and salt. Saute for 1 minute. Then add the cooked beans. Mix them all well. Mash them using a hand blender. Steam cook the broccoli and carrots for 3 minutes. Preheat the oven for 375F. In a separate pan, heat olive oil/butter. Saute the onion, bell pepper. Fry well, then add cooked broccoli and carrots. Add ground cumin, garlic powder and salt. Remove from pan. In a bowl add the refried beans, above fried vegetables, 1 cup salsa, torn tortilla, half of the olives, cheese, tomatoes. Mix them well. Oil the casserole pan, transfer the beans mixture. Top them with remaining olives, tomatoes, cheese, broken tortilla chips. Cover and bake in the oven for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and let it stand for 5 minutes before opening. Serve got with avocado.

When ever I make falafels, I always make huge batch(atleast 50) Yeah everyone in my household likes it. My little one lovvvvvvvvvvves it. Also its nutritious. I give him this as a snack...he munches and walk away happily! Well, I freeze most of them. It does freeze well. I just thaw them and place it in a preheated oven for 15 minutes...Voila! its as crispy as it was the day I fried them. I also MW them in a hurry, it is also good but not crispy.

For falafel sandwich, I spread hummus on the bread, break the falafel and place it over the spread. Then squeeze some tahini sauce. Place sliced tomatoes and lettuce. Cover with another hummus bread. Its a filling vegan lunch.

Ingredients:

  • Potatoes - 1 lb
  • White wine vinegar - 2 tbsp
  • Greek yogurt - 1/2 cup
  • Sour cream - 1/4 cup
  • Canola loil - 1 tbsp
  • Red onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Garlic - 1 clove, minced
  • Parsley - 2 tbsp. finely chopped
  • Dill - 1 tbsp, finely chopped
  • Salt & pepper

Directions:

Cook the potatoes in the boiling water. Just be careful, it should be just cooked, not over cooked or under cooked.

Peel off the skin and cube them. Sprinkle with white vinegar and keep aside in a bowl.

In another bowl, combine yogurt, sour cream, oil, onion, garlic, parsley, dill, salt & pepper as per taste. Mix them well.

Toss in your potatoes. Mix gently so each cubes are thoroughly covered with yogurt mix. Cover tightly and keep it in the refrigerator for atleast 3 hours.

Serve chill.

Ingredients:

  • spaghetti
  • Bell peppers - 1/2 each of red, green, yellow, julienned
  • Squash - 1 cup, julienned
  • Zucchini - 1 cup, julienned
  • Italian seasoning
  • Salt & pepper
  • Olive oil - 2 tbsp
 

Directions:

Put all the veggies in a bowl. Add salt & pepper, oil...toss them all well, roast in a preheated oven at 375F for 25 mins.

Meanwhile cook your pasta as per the package direction.

Heat little olive oil in pan, add the roasted veggies and Italian seasoning(1 tsp), add the pasta, toss them all well.

Serve with grated pramesan(optional.)

Ingredients:

  • Rice - 1 cup, long grain preferable
  • Onion - 1/2 chopped, medium sized
  • Onion - 2 tbsp, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 2, chopped
  • Tomato paste - 1 tbsp
  • Garlic - 2 cloves, minced
  • Jalapenos - 1, finely chopped or any green chili
  • Bay leaves - 1
  • Cilantro - 1 tbsp, chopped
  • Corn - 1/4 cup, frozen
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Vegetable broth - 2 cups. you could also use chicken broth.

Directions:

Place the tomatoes and chopped onions in a blender and blend to a smooth puree.

Heat oil in a pan, add the onion , garlic, jalapenos and fry them well. Add the washed rice and fry for 3 minutes on low-medium heat.

Ad the corn, tomato paste, bay leaf, cilantro, tomato-onion puree and broth. Add salt. Mix them well. Cover and cook on medium heat until rice is done.

Remove from heat, fluff the rice and serve hot.

Ingredients:

  • Sesame puree - 3tbsp
  • Garlic - 2 cloves, minced
  • Water - 1/4 cup
  • Lemon juice - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Cumin powder - a pinch

Directions:

I used store bought sesame paste. You could also make one at home.

Mix them together in a bowl, beat them well. Tahini sauce is ready.

Ingredients:

  • Chicken - 1 lb, cut into small pieces
  • Vegetables - 2 cups, broccoli, mushrooms, bell peppers
  • Red onion - 1, thinly sliced
Seasonings:
  • Garlic powder - 1 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1 tsp
  • Smoked paprika powder - 1 tsp
  • Lime juice - 1 tbsp
  • Olive oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Crushed red chili flakes - 1 tsp
Other Ingredients:
  • Tortilla
  • Sour cream
  • Black beans
  • Spanish rice
  • Guacamole
 

Directions:

Mix all the seasoning ingredients together in a ziplog bag and add the vegetables, chicken. Mix them all well & marinate for 2 hrs. Heat your griddle(cast iron), when its sizzling hot, first saute the onion, bell peppers, mushrooms, broccoli separately one after other. Finally saute the marinated chicken. Keep them all aside.Warm your tortillas & serve with chicken & veg fajita with a scoop of sour cream, guacamole, mexican rice, salsa & beans. Enjoy!

I had left over dill leaves that I bought for making Greek potato salad. I was wondering what should I do with this half a bunch. Searched for dill recipes, and this dill rice caught my eyes... so tried it today and it came out really really good. Its almost like lemon rice, pretty easy to make. I'm glad that I didn't waste the left over dill leaves :)

   

Ingredients

  • Cooked basmati rice - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1/2 cup finely chopped
  • Jalapeno/Green chilies - 2 nos, finely chopped
  • Garlic - 2 pods, finely chopped
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Urad dal/Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Lemon juice - 4 tbsp
  • Dill leaves - 1 cup, finely chopped
  • Salt - 1 tbsp
 

Directions:

  • Heat oil in a pan, splutter cumin seeds/Urad dal. Saute the onion, chilies, garlic pods for 2 minutes. Don't brown them.
  • Add the dill leaves, turmeric powder & salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
  • Turn off the heat, let it cool down.
  • Add the cooked rice & pour lemon juice over the top & mix them all well.
  • Dill rice is ready to savor.

Ingredients:

  • Broccoli florets - 1 lb, chopped
  • Red onion - 1 medium, sliced
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
 

Directions:

Heat oil in a pan. Saute the onion, once it started turning brown, add the gg paste & fry till the raw smell is gone.

Add the chopped tomatoes, salt & all powders. Fry for 3 minutes(sprinkling little water if needed)

Add the chopped broccoli florets, sprinkle a handful of water. Mix everything well, cover the pan and cook on medium-low heat for upto 10 minutes. Stirring in between to avoid any char.

Broccoli should be done by now. It should be crispy, don't over cook it(that will spoil the taste & texture, I feel, broccoli tastes better when ALMOST cooked, not completely cooked.)

Serve hot. It can be accompanied with roti or hot white rice, pulov...

Ingredients:

  • Leftover idli - 8
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1 cup, chopped
  • Green onions - 1/4 cup, chopped
  • Cilantro - 2 tbsp, chopped for garnishing
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/1 tsp
  • Red chili sauce - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt & pepper
  • Lemon juice(optional)
 

Directions:

Cut each idli into 6 or 8 pieces. Shallow fry in little oil. Keep them aside.

In the same fried pan with some left over oil, splutter mustard seeds. Add cumin seeds. Add chopped onion ,gg paste and fry well. Then add the tomato paste, red chili powder and salt. Fry till tomato becomes mushy. Now add the red chili sauce, pepper powder, green onion, fired idli. Toss them all well, idli pieces should be coated with the gravy.

Remove from stove. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with few drops of lemon juice over the top.

Ingredients:

  • Chickpeas - 1 cup
  • Garlic powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Paprika - 1/2 tsp
  • Chat masala - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tsp
  • Cooking spray

Directions:

Soak the dry chickpeas overnight and pressure cook them till they become soft. If you are using canned chickpeas, omit this step & drain and dry the chickpeas.

Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl & add 1 tbsp oil. Toss in the chickpeas and mix well, make sure all of them are coated with masal powders.

Preheat your oven to 375F. Spread the chickpeas on a baking sheet & spray some more oil and bake for 30 minutes.

Roasted chickpeas are ready. Its a very healthy snack. You could make it in bulk and store in an airtight container. It stays fresh for upto 7 days.

Friends visited us last Sunday(actually it was K's birthday), I made Mediterranean food. The main menu was falafel wrap with flat bread, moroccan salad & home made tahini, Greek potato salad, Vegetable couscous salad. As you know, making falafel is quite a work. So I made rest other dishes on Saturday night ,so that I could have time to make fresh falafel.

I'm so glad that I did, because these salads tasted much better on Sunday. Of course these aren't going to take much time, but making previous day would definitely be a good idea. For the big crowd, if you want to make something good and also don't want to look tired on the party, then this must be the best bet. You could easily make these the previous day, refrigerate overnight... Voila! serve chilled the next day.

For this salad, you can pretty much add what ever veggies you want, eggplant, artichokes, greens, mushrooms...

Ingredients:

  • Couscous - 1.5 cups
  • Corn - 1/2 cup
  • Bell pepper - 1, finely chopped
  • Carrots - 1 cup, finely diced
  • Cucumber - 1/2 cup, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 1 ,chopped
  • Salt & Black pepper
  • Olive oil - 1 tbsp

Directions:

Cook the couscous as per the package directions.

Heat olive oil, saute the carrots & corn for 4 minutes.

Add the cooked couscous in a big bowl. Add all the vegetables into the bowl. Sprinkle salt & pepper, toss them all well.

Refrigerate it & serve cold.

This chipotle style rice is very easy to make. I make this more often because my little one likes it so much, that he feeds this rice himself. It can be served with beans, lentil curry or even plain dal. And you need only 6 ingredients to make this rice, so simple.

 

Ingredients:

  • Rice - 1 cup, I used basmati
  • Cilantro - 1 cup, chopped
  • Lime juice - 2 tbsp
  • Garlic - 4 pods
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Butter - 2 tbsp

Directions:

Wash & cook the rice with 1.5 cups water & 2 tbsp butter.

Meanwhile, blend the garlic pods, cilantro, lime juice & salt in a blender/food processor.

Add this paste into the cooked rice, mix well with few finely chopped cilantro.

Thats it, ready to be served.

• Azuki beans(red chori, thatta payir) - 1 cup
  • Bottlegourd (surakkai) - 1 medium sized
  • Onion - 3 tbsp, chopped
  • Curry leaves - few leaves (optional)
  • Tamarind paste - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil/Ghee - 2 tbsp
Roast & Grind:
  • Onion - 1 medium, chopped
  • Red chilies - 3
  • Curry leaves - a few
  • Coconut - 1/2 cup, grated
  • Coriander powder - 1 tbsp

Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a pan, saute the onion till it starts browning. Add coconut, red chilies, curry leaves, coriander powder. Roast for 2 minutes & remove from heat. Let it cool & make a fine paste. Keep aside. Wash the bottle gourd. Cut into half lengthwise. Remove the seeds inside(along with soft parts). Then chop the vegetable into tiny pieces. Heat oil in a pan/pressure cooker. Saute the onions. Add the vegetable(surakkai), turmeric powder, salt and fry for 2 minutes. Add the washed azuki beans & 3 cups water. Cook for 3 whistles or until the bean is cooked well. Add the ground paste, tamarind paste & 1/2 more cup water(if needed), bring to a boil & remove from heat. It can be served with hot rice or it can be taken as a soup.

• Crab - 1/2 lb (I used king crab legs)
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped finely
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Garlic - 5, chopped & pressed
  • Coconut - 1/4 cup
  • Curry leaves - few
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
Spices:
  • Dried red chilies - 3, broken
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Black pepper - 1 tsp
  • Fennel seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cinnamon sticks - 1"
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
Method: Steam cook the crab for atleast 10 minutes. Let it cool, then remove the shells & take meat(actually its a pretty east step after steam cook.) Chop the meat into 1" pieces. Keep them aside. Dry roast the red chilies, pepper, fennel seeds, cinnamon sticks, cumin seeds. Keep aside. Fry the onions in little oil. Grind the onion with garlic, coconut & dry roasted spices. Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves & fry the finely chopped onions. Once it starts browning, add the tomatoes, salt, turmeric powder. After 2 minutes add the ground paste with 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Now add the chopped crab meat, cover and cook for 3 more minutes on medium heat. Serve hot with rice.

This is a one-pot recipe. Normally we would make sambar in a little different method - cook dal & vegetables in a pan and fry & season it in other pan. And we mix it together. Today I wanted to try it in a single pan. It tasted equally good, I mean we couldn't tell any difference. Try this method; Save you cleaning time; :-)

  • Toor dal - 1 cup
  • Broad beans / Avarakkai - 1/4 lb, chopped finely
  • Onion - 1, sliced
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Green chilies - 2, chopped
  • Curry leaves - few
  • Sambar powder - 2 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
Seasoning:
  • Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Tamarind paste - 1 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Hing - 1/4 tsp
Method: Soak the dal in water. Keep aside. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker/pan, splutter mustard seeds. Add hing. Then add curry leaves, onion, chilies, turmeric powder, sambar powder. Fry in the ghee for few seconds. Then add the avarakkai & tomato. Fry for 30 seconds. Now add the dal & 2 cups of water, tamarind paste & salt. Pressure cook it or until the dal is fully cooked. Sambar is ready. Serve with idli/dosa or hot rice.

There is no better dish that compliments poori than this potato masala. Its called 'Poori masal' not without a reason! 15 minutes and its ready!!!

Whenever my mom makes poori, we always had competition who gets the next hot puffy poori. Mom places the hot bubbly poori right from the stove to the empty plate. So we eat fast to get the next one. Gone are those days. hmmmmm.....

  • Potato - 4 nos, medium sized
  • Onion - 1, thinly sliced
  • Green chilies - 4 nos, chopped
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Ginger - 1 tbsp, grated
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Besan flour - 1/4 cup
  • Salt - to taste
  • Coriander leaves/Cilantro - for garnishing
Seasoning:
  • Ghee - 1 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Curry leaves - few (optional)
Method: Boil the potatoes with little salt. Once potato is cooked, let them cool. Then cube into 1" pieces & keep aside. Heat ghee in a pan, add the seasonings. After 20 seconds add the onion & green chilies and fry till onions becomes translucent. Add the tomato, ginger, turmeric powder & salt. Cook for 2 minutes or till tomato is cooked. Mix the besan flour in 1 cup water & add it to the pan. Stir them all well. Add little more water depending on the consistency you need. Cook on medium heat. When it starts boiling add the cubed boiled potatoes. Mix them well. Garnish with coriander leaves & serve hot with poori.

• Tomato - 2 nos,chopped
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Dried red chilies - 2 nos,
  • Garlic - 2 pods
  • Curry leaves - a few
  • Salt - to taste
  • Ginger - 1"
  • Channa dal - 2 tbsp
  • Urad dal - 2 tbsp
  • Ghee - 1 tbsp
Method: Heat ghee in a frying pan, fry the dals for 20 seconds. Saute the onion, chilies, curry leaves, garlic until onion starts browning. Add the tomatoes, salt, ginger & fry till that tomatoes are cooked well on med-low heat. Let it cool & make a nice paste in a blender. (If you want, season it with some more ghee, mustard seeds, curry leaves & 1/2 tsp channa dal) Its the best side dish for dosa, idli, uthappam.

• Coconut - 1 cup, grated (I used frozen)
  • Raw mango - 1 (grated half of the mango & make a coarse paste of the other half)
  • Green chilies - 5 nos, slitted
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad dal - 1 tsp
  • Split channa dal - 1 tsp
  • Ginger - 1 tbsp, grated
  • Cooked rice - 2 cups
  • Salt - to taste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Curry leaves - a few
Heat ghee in a pan, splutter mustard seeds & cumin seeds. Add the curry leaves. After 10 seconds add the urad dal & channa dal and fry well. Add the onion & green chilies. Once onions start turning golden brown add the grated ginger, coarse mango, turmeric powder & salt & fry for 3 minutes. Then add the grated mango & half of the grated coconut. Mix & fry them well for 2 more minutes. Now add the cooked rice & the remaining grated coconut. Mix gently till the rice is coated with masal. Serve with raitha, pickle.

• Moog dal - 3/4 cup
  • Ridgegourd - 1
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Green chilies - 3 nos, chopped
  • Ghee/Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Water - 2 cups
  • Curry leaves - few (optional)

__________________________________

Wash & pressure cook the moong dal with 2 cups water, turmeric powder & salt. Clean the ridgegourd. Slightly scrape the outer skin of the gourd. Halve the vegetable lengthwise & remove the seeds & flesh. Now cut the vegetable into 1/2" pieces. Cook the dal for 3 whistles. Now add the vegetable, half of the onion, tomatoes, 1 green chili and pressure cook again for 3 more whistles. Meanwhile, heat ghee in a frying pan, splutter mustard seeds... add cumin seeds & curry leaves. Add the remaining onion, green chilies & fry till onion turns light brown. Switch off the stove. Add this seasoning to the cooked dal & vegetable. Mix well & serve hot. It goes well with white rice. Or it can be eaten as it it, which I prefer.

* Pressure cooking half of the raw onions, gives little crunchiness. You can use both whole moong dal & split ones. * Don't overcook the dal, otherwise it'll become mushy. You should still feel the dal & vegetables in every bite.

Vegetables -
  • Cauliflower - 2 cups florets, appx 1/2 of the medium sized flower.
  • Green bell pepper/Capsicum - 1, cubed
  • Mushroom - 1 cup, sliced
  • Paneer - 1.5 cups, cubed
  • Peas - 1 cup
  • Tomato - 1, diced
Masala -
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tbsp
  • Red chili powder - 1 tbsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tbsp
  • Kasoori methi - 1 tbsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp
Seasoning -
  • Oil/Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
Grind to paste -
  • Cashew nut - 10 nos, soaked in warm milk
Method : Fry the cubed paneer & soak in the water. Keep aside. Shallow fry the cauliflower florets in oil & keep aside. Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds & cumin seeds. Saute the onion till it starts getting golden brown. Add in the ginger garlic paste & fry till the raw smell is gone. Add the turmeric powder, salt, coriander powder, red chili powder. Add the bell pepper, mushroom, peas, tomatoes and mix them well. Cover & cook for 2 minutes. Meanwhile, grind the cashew nut with little milk. Now add this paste to the pan & cook for 3 more minutes. Add the cauliflower, fired paneer. Give a gentle mix. Add the garam masala & kasoori methi leaves(crushed by hand.) Mix gently & cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot with chapati, hot rice, puloa, roti, naan...

K took off from work that day... we both had cold, so we weren't up for going out for lunch... its been like almost a week, since we had a good meal, because of sore throat, cold :( As K was at home, I was so in mood to cook...Referred this 'handy tip book' they gave with prestige cooker. dahi bhindi, dhingiri dolma & vegetable puloa.

• Bitter gourd - 3
  • Besan flour - 2 tbsp
  • Red chili powder - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp

------------------------------------------------------------

Wash & cut the bitter gourd into thin round slices, removing the seeds & flesh inside. Sprinkle some salt & keep the vegetable in a colander & keep aside for 10 - 20 minutes. This will drain the water from the bittergourd & also removes some bitterness. Mix the red chili powder, coriander powder, little salt, turmeric powder, besan flour. Add the bitter gourd & mix well. Make sure vegetable is coated with this spice mix thoroughly. Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, shallow fry the bitter gourd, until it turns crispy. Serve hot with rice & sambar, rasam.

I used frozen parotta bought from the Indian store. But you can make your own parotta at home. If you want, substitute it with chapati, roti, malaysian parotta.

  • Parotta – 6
  • Onion – 2 medium sized, chopped
  • Tomato – 2 medium sized, chopped
  • Green chilies – 3, slitted
  • Coriander leaves – 2 tbsp, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste – 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Red chili powder – 1 tsp
  • Oil/Ghee – 2 tsp
  • Mustard seeds – 1/2 tsp
Method: Thaw the parottas & cook on the hot tava for 2 minutes on each side. Keep the hot parottas aside. Once you are done cooking, arrange them one by one on the top. Hold the pile & shake them with your hands(this is to loosen them up.) Then cut each parotta into thin pieces - 2" either with a knife or tear them with your hands. Keep it aside. Now heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan, splutter mustard seeds. Saute the onion for 4 minutes, till it starts turning golden brown. Add the ginger garlic paste & fry till the raw smell is gone. Add the tomatoes, green chilies, salt, red chili powder & turmeric powder. Cook on medium heat for 3 minutes. Don't over cook the tomatoes. Now add the cooked parotta pieces & coriander leaves. Mix them all well. Fry for 2 more minutes. Serve hot with raita, kuruma.

Lemon rice is the most popular yet simple variety rice in South India. It doesn't give any strong smell, so its a good lunch box recipe. Back home, we usually make lemon rice when we go out for a day trip to Temple, park, farm...Tamarind rice, curd(yogurt)rice & Lemon rice are the popular pack-it-with-you-for-your-trip dishes. They stay fresh for a day long or two, you don't even have to re-heat, they can be eaten as it is... When taken as lunch box, its always best to serve with 'poriyal' (vegetable saute.) Or (when you feel lazy to cook or don't have time) it can be accompanied with hot pickles, raitha, chips... Simple ingredients that you'll need:
  • Lemon - 2
  • Cooked white rice - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Green chilies or dried red chilies - 2 nos, chopped (adjust the number depends on your spice level)
  • Oil/Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Urad dal - 1 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp

  • Peanuts - 2 tbsp(optional)
  • Raisins - 1 tbsp(optional)

Switch off the stove & add the lemon juice & mix well. Then pour this over the cooked rice & mix well. Rice'll turn yellow & coated with spicy & salty & sour lemon juice. Thats it...isn't is simple?

These days I'm trying to cook dishes that need less effort,but at the same time nutrition rich. One of such dishes is 'Briyani' - vegetarian or non vegetarian. For me, cooking briyani is always a big deal. But after today, I felt Briyani is easier to prepare than cooking curries & rice or roti. Of course I'm not going to cook this everyday - maybe once every 2-3 weeks should be good! I asked my perimma(Banu) how she makes chicken briyani - her briyani is a hit in our crowd. I tried to remember what her secret was - couldnt recollect fully except for the word - 'dum', as in 'hyderabadi dum briyani'. Decided to call and ask her. And this is post of that recipe. Usually when we have a large get-tegother in our place(back home), we get a chef or two to cook during the occasion. If the crowd isnt that big then our mom/aunts do the cooking. My perimma told me that they learnt the recipe for this 'dum briyani' from one of the chefs who cooked for us ('Dhandapani') The majority of the cooking happens in our backyard - mostly on big stoves made temporarily by arranging large stones ('kal-adupu') or a cast iron stove ('irumbu-adupu'). Wood is used in both as fuel. Cooking is done in huge aluminum pots to feed the large hungry crowd ('us')!!! Once the briyani is made in these pots (stove fire is put out), its covered with a lid, and then some hot charcoal from the stove is put on top of the lid. The pot is left that way for about 15 mins or so. This is supposed to enhance the flavor. Nowadays they use bigger gas stove for cooking, no more kal aduppu or irumbu aduppu or wood. So they follow other techniques. I'll post that later. For me the above dum's won't workout, so Perimma told this technique which I posted here. Ingredients yoy'll need: For rice:
  • Basmati or Briyani rice - 4 cups
  • Cinnamon sticks - 2 "
  • Cloves - 6 nos
  • Cardamom - 4 nos
  • Saffron - 6 strands
  • Ghee/Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Bay leaves - 2
  • Water - 6 cups
For gravy:
  • Mixed vegetables - 6 cups ( i used 3 cup frozen vegetables pack that has peas, carrots, beans, corn, lima beans & 1 cup cauliflower florets & 2 cups chopped potatoes)
  • Onion - 2 big sized, finely sliced
  • Green chilies - 4, sliced
  • Ginger garlic paste - 2 tbsp
  • Mint leaves - 1/2 cup. chopped
  • Coriander leaves - 1 cup, chopped
  • Yogurt - 1 cup
  • Water - 1/2 cup
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil/Ghee - 3 tbsp
Spices:
  • Red chili powder - 4 tbsp
  • Coriander powder - 3 tbsp
  • Garam masala pwoder - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1 tsp
Whole garam masala:
  • Cinnamon - 2 2" sticks
  • Cloves - 6 nos
  • Cardamom - 4
  • Fennel seeds - 1 tsp
For seasoning:
  • Cashew nuts - 1/2 cup
  • Raisin - 1/4 cup
  • Ghee - 1 tbsp
Cooking method: Rice: Wash the rice & add all the ingredients. Cook the rice & keep them aside. Making gravy: Heat oil in a pan & add the whole garam masala items & fry for 30 seconds. Saute the sliced onions & green chilies. After few minutes add the GG paste & fry till the raw smell is gone. Add all the spice powders & salt. Cook for 1 minute, then add the vegetables. Mix them all well & cook for 3 minutes. Mix the yougrt with water, beat them & add to the pan. Cover & cook for 2 more minutes. Now vegetables should be almost done. Seasonning: Heat ghee in a small skillet & fry the raisins & cashewnut. Mixing rice & gravy: On a heavy bottomed pan, spread the gravy & add a layer of rice. Then sprinkle chopped mint & coriander leaves. Again spread some gravy, some rice & leaves. Repeat a couple of times and finally top it off with the remaining gravy. Garnish with fried nuts on top. Cover the pan with a clean kitchen towel. Then cover with a lid/plate. Above the lid keep any heavy item. I put stone pestel & mortar. Lower the flame and cook for 20 minutes. After 20 mins, open up and mix the contents nicely and serve hot with raita/side of your choice! Hope you enjoy eating the dish as much as we did!

  • Briyani/Basmathi rice - 2 cups
  • Goat/Mutton/Lamb - 1 pound
  • Onion - 2 onions, sliced
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Cloves - 5 nos
  • Cinnamon - 2" stick
  • Bay leaves - 2
  • Cardamom - 2 nos
  • Fennel seeds - 1 tsp
  • Marathi mogu - 2 nos
  • Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Star ansie - 2 nos
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tbsp
  • Coconut milk - 1 cup
  • Mint leaves - 1 cup
  • Plain yogurt - 1 cup
  • Green chilies - 2 nos
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tbsp
  • Saffron - few strands
  • Lemon juice - 1/2 cup
Clean and wash the meat and marinate it with red chili powder, turmeric powder, lemon juice, yogurt and salt.

Cook 2 cups basamathi rice along with 1 cup coconut milk, saffron, ghee and 1 cup water. Half cook the rice and keep it aside.

Heat oil in a pan, add fennel seeds, cloves, star ansie, cinnamom, bay leaves, cardamom, marathi mogu and fry for 1 minute. Add onion and fry for 3 minutes, add ginger garlic paste and green chilies. Fry for another 2 minutes until the raw smell goes. Add mint leaves, chopped tomato, salt and red chili powder and fry for 5 more minutes.

When raw smell is gone, add the marinated meat, mix them very well and pressure cook it for 20 minutes.

Once its done, layer your baking tray with this cooked meat gravy and then layer it with half cooked rice, pack them tightly, cover and cook it in the preheat oven at 375F for 30 minutes. Take them out, mix well and serve hot with raitha

I had left over rotini, cavatappi, mini seashell pastas. I wanted to finish it before getting new packet. So I just mixed all these leftover pasta and it turned out good.
  • Pasta - 2 cups
  • Broccoli - 1 cup
  • Mushroom - 1 cup, diced
  • Zucchini - 1 cup, sliced
  • Yellow onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Olive oil - 1/2 cup
  • Garlic - 2 pods, chopped and crushed
  • Rosemary, dried - 1/2 tsp
  • Oregano, dried - 1/2 tsp
  • Black pepper - 1/2 tsp
  • Dried red chili flakes - 1 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Fontina - 1/2 cup, grated
  • Mozzarella - 1/2 cup, shredded
Cook the pasta as per the directions in the package. Run it under the cold water, drain it and keep it aside. Heat olive oil in a wide open frying pan, add all the herbs along with garlic, fry for 30 seconds. Fry onion for 1 minute. Then add all other vegetables except mushroom(it oozes water, you don't need your veggies watery, save it for later.) Make sure vegetables are fried well and add mushroom and salt. Transfer everything to a serving tray sprinkle shredded mozzarella and serve hot :)

Last Friday we had friends for dinner. That was a sudden plan. I made south Indian full meal, as they love South Indian foods. Initially I thought potato finger fry for appetizer, later I realized time wasn't really enough to deep fry them. Kartik gave this idea, baking the masala potatoes instead of frying. (Seriously I feel bad throwing away the oil used for frying, also I can't use it again.) It saved lot of time & oil. Taste wasn't compromised.Its a very crispy, easy & healthy appetizer.

[I didn't take a picture when it was fresh & hot, above pix was the leftover and was taken the next day!]
  • Potatoes - 4 nos
  • Garlic - 5 pods, finely chopped & crushed
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tbsp
  • Fennel seeds - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Oil - 1/2 cup
Steam cook the potatoes for 10 minutes(half cook.) Then cut into 1" pieces. Grind cumin seeds and fennel seeds and make a coarse powder. Make a mixture of garlic, cumin seeds mixture, oil, red chili powder and salt. Toss in your cubed potatoes into the mixture and mix well. All the potatoes should be coated with the mixture. Spray cooking oil on an aluminum foil/baking tray, spread the potato masala on the plate. Spray some oil over the potatoes. Bake it in a preheat oven (350F) for 20 to 30 minutes. Broil for 5 minutes before removing. Serve hot!

• Chicken pieces - 1 lb, cubed
  • Onion - 1, chopped
  • Tomato - 2, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 3 tsps
  • Cumin powder - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Coriander leaves - for garnishing
  • Lemon juice - 2 tbsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp
Marinating the chicken: Rub turmeric, salt & lemon juice mixture over the cubed chicken pieces and marinate for 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, fry the onion, add ginger garlic paste and once the raw smell goes off, add all masala powders. Saute for some more time or until the masala gets cooked. Take 3/4 of this mixture, let it cool down and grind it to paste in a blender and add it back to the frying pan contents. Now add the chicken pieces, mix thoroughly with the ground & unground masala. Add just enough water to cover the chicken pieces. Let it cook for 10 minutes on low heat, then add the cut tomatoes, cook for another 15 minutes on low heat. If you want it little thicker, increase the heat and let it boil for 2 minutes. Now get your plate with roti or rice and pour over the masala & savor the flavor!

For pizza base:

  • All purpose flour - 3 cups
  • Dry yeast - 1 tbsp
  • Sugar - ½ tbsp
  • Salt - ½ tbsp
  • Milk - ½ cup
  • Butter - ½ cup
  • Egg - 2 no (optional)
  • Warm water - 1/4 cup

To the warm water ad dry yeast, then add sugar and salt. (water should be warm, neither hot nor cold). Keep it aside for 20 minutes.

Add eggs and butter to the milk and whisk well until all gets thoroughly mixed.

Take flour in a wide mouth bowl, add yeast mixture and mix well. Gradually add milk mixture and mix well.

Now use your hands and knead the mixture for 20 minutes to make a soft dough (add dry flour if it is sticky while kneading, even you can wet your hands with little oil.)

After thorough kneading, cover the bowl with a soft cloth and keep the bowl in a warm place for at least 2 hours.

After that you can see the dough doubled in size, knead the dough again(now its not sticky) and use your rolling pin, make a circular layer of ½” thickness.

For the white sauce:

  • EV Olive oil - 1 cup
  • Garlic - 4 pods, crushed
  • Rosemary - 1/2 tsp
  • Oregano - 1/2 tsp
  • Dried Basil leaves - 1/2 tsp
  • Black pepper - 1/4 tsp
  • Dried red chili flakes - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp

Heat the oil, fry garlic pods for 2 minutes, add rest other ingredients and fry for 2 more minutes. ( on medium heat.) White sauce is ready, keep the aside.

Toppings:

  • Olives - 1/2 cup, sliced
  • Jalepeno - 1/4 cup, sliced
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, sliced
  • Tomato - 1/2 cup, sliced
  • Artichokes - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Shredded Mozzerella cheese - 1 cup

Place the pizza base on the pizza stone. Add 1/2 cup of white sauce, add 1/2 cup of cheese. Then throw in all your toppings. Pour remaining white sauce all over the top again followed by remaining cheese.

Place the stone in a preheated oven (375F). Bake it for 30 minutes.

Cool them for 10 minutes, before serving.

Brussels sprouts curry

I used frozen baby Brussels sprouts to make this gravy. If you use normal Brussels sprouts, cut them into two and rest are the same. Either way, make small pores on the vegetable. It gives more flavor to the vegetable. Otherwise basically Brussels sprout tastes bland!
  • Brussel sprouts - 1 pound
  • Onion - 2 cups, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 2 cups, chopped
  • Dry red chilies/fresh green chilies - 3 nos
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tsp ( or use chopped fresh garlic & ginger)
  • Coriander powder - 1.5 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 4 tbsp
  • Cloves - 4 to 6 nos
  • Cinnamom sticks - 2" piece
  • Fennel seeds - 1 tsp

Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cloves, fennel seeds, cinnamon sticks, chilies, add onion and fry till it turns brown, add ginger garlic paste & tomato and fry for 2 more minutes. Let it cool.

Make 2 or 3 small pores on the sprouts, so that some gravy can go inside making the vegetable more tasty.

Heat the remaining oil and fry brussel sprouts(till the outer layer is fried well,) remove from pan and keep them aside.

Grind the onion mixture along with coriander powder and make a smooth paste. Heat a pan, add this paste and 1 cup water, bring them to a boil(cook on medium heat.)

Add fried sprouts & salt. Cook them on low heat for 15 minutes until raw smell goes.

Serve hot with roti, rice...

• Yam - 2 cups, cubed (I used frozen yam)
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1.5 cups, chopped
  • Garlic - 5 pods, sliced
  • Green chilies - 2 nos, copped
  • Tamarind water - 1 cup
  • Brown sugar - a pinch
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Sesame oil - 4 tbsp
  • Methi seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp

Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, fry methi seeds, followed by onion, green chilies & garlic. Fry them well, till raw smell goes. Add tomatoes and saute for 2 more mins.

Add all masala powders & salt, cook on medium heat for 15 minutes, make sure to add little water to avoid charring.

Now add tamarind water,sugar and bring them to a boil. Add yam, cook on low heat for 10 to 15 minutes.

Serve hot with rice.

• Noodles
  • Firm tofu - 1 cup, sliced into cubes
  • Red bellpepper - 1 cup, deseeded, cut lengthwise
  • Green bell pepper - 1 cup, deseeded, cut lengthwise
  • Green beans - 10 nos
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, cut lengthwise
  • Broccoli - 1 cup, small florets
  • Garlic clove - 2, sliced
  • Ginger - 1" piece, finely sliced
  • Sesame oil - 4 tbsp
  • Basil leaves - 4 to 5
  • Mushroom - 1 cup, sliced
  • Brown Sugar - a pinch, optional
  • Salt - to taste
  • Red chili - 1, finely chopped, ( add 1 more if you want it really spicy)
  • Peanut powder - 2 tbsp
Cook the noodles as per the cooking directions in the packet.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a wide pan, fry the tofu and keep them aside. Heat remaining oil in the same pan, fry the onions, garlic, ginger & chilies. Add vegetables, basil leaves and salt, let them cook. Add brown sugar. Once the veggies are cooked well, add fried tofu & noodles. Mix them well. Before serving sprinkle peanut powder on the top & serve hot.

• Wheat flour - 2 cups
  • Water - 1 cup
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 2 tbps
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped,optional
  • Tomato - 1 cup, chopped, optional
  • Green chilies/red chilies - 2, finely chopped
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Ghee

Method:

In a big bowl add flour, then add water slowly stirring well to avoid forming lumps. Mae a nice batter.

Add salt, chopped onion, tomato & chilies.

Heat oil and splutter cumin seeds, add them to the batter. Mix them well and keep it aside.

Heat your dosa pan/tava, once it is hot enough, pour a ladle of batter and spread evenly in circular motion. Pour ghee over the top. Cover and cook, after 1 minute, flip the dosa to the other side and cook for about a minute. Remove from stove and serve with chutney or gravy.

• Chicken thighs - 10 pieces
  • Red chili powder - 2 tbsp
  • Paprika powder - 1 tbsp (optional)
  • Yogurt - 1 cup
  • Lemon juice - 1/4 cup
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tbsp
  • Coriander powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Besan flour(split channa dal flour) or corn flour - 2 tbsp
1) Clean your chicken thighs thoroughly, dry them. Mix all the ingredient items together.

2) Drop in the thighs one by one, wait before that you have to poke the meat surface at each side using a fork or knife, in that way, your masals will go inside the thigh making the tandoori chicken tastes better.

3) Make sure all pieces are coated with masals thoroughly.

4) Preheat you oven to 350F. Take your baking sheet/tray, spray some cooking oil. Place the chicken pieces leaving generous room for each piece so that no pieces touch together.

5) Bake it in the oven for 30 minutes and broil it for 10 minutes. Remove from oven, let it cool and enjoy your tandoori chicken with onion raita, mint chutney or fresh lemon & onion.

6) In the same way you can substitute Turkey for chicken to make 'Turkey Tandoori'.

Spinach channa curry

  • Kaala channa (black channa) - 1 cup
  • Spinach - 4 cups, chopped
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1 cup, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp

Soak channa dal in water overnight and pressure cook them with salt and keep them aside.

Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, saute onion till becomes translucent. Add ginger garlic paste, fry till raw smell in them is gone.

Add chopped tomatoes and all masala powders with salt. Cover and cook them for 3 minutes, stirring often to avoid charring.

Add spinach leaves and channa dal, mix them well together, turn the heat to low, cover and cook for 10 minutes.

Serve hot with roti,rice...

• Small green eggplants - 1 lb, cut into 4 long pieces
  • Thai green curry paste - 2 tbsp ( I used 'Thai Kitchen Authentic' )
  • Coconut milk - 1 cup
  • Fish sauce - 1/2 tsp
  • Dried red pepper - 2 nos, broken
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
Simmer the coconut milk in a heavy bottomed vessel, add green curry paste. Bring it to a boil stirring often. Then add fish sauce, salt, red pepper & eggplant. Cover and cook them on med heat for 15 minutes. Eggplant curry is ready to savor :)

My amma used to make Tapioca fry as an evening snack taken along with some hot drinks. That too in a rainy day, eating hotty spicy Tapioca is yummmmmmmm! We all sit together watching rain outside having a bite of Tapioca + a sip of Coriander seeds kaapi (Yes! it is kaapi, not coffee ;) We never bought it from outside... whenever it is harvested in our farm, they used send us a big bag of fresh Tapioca.., we share it with our neighbors... even my grandma or other uncles too, they also send it us to share with our neighbors. So pretty much year round we have Tapioca in our place! We make it whenever we want, not much often though ;) But here I never saw Tapioca, infact haven't had a thought for it ( was wondering if its available here) That day in an Indian store, I happened to browse for frozen veggies, there it caught my eyes. hmmmm, it brought me back those good old dayz. I took a pack. Did I tell you it slept in my freezer for more than a month? Whenever K opens the freezer, he asks me, what are you going to do with this?!??!? I was like I don't know... (see I don't know the recipe, was thinking of asking amma, but whenever I chat with her, I always forgot to ask the recipe...(not only this, but its a big list of recipes...) It was raining in early Jan, today I should make this, right away called amma and got her recipe. Evening I made before K came home... We enjoyed it so much with a cup of hot chai. Tapioca is full of carbs with 1g fiber and 3g Iron. Diabetic persons are not supposed to eat Tapioca as it contains little sugar.

  • Tapioca - 4 pieces( I used frozen one, it comes in 4x3" size)
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Ginger - 1 tsp, grated
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad dal - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Hing - a pinch
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig, for garnishing
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig ( optional)
Pressure cook the tapioca roots with 2 cups of water and 1/2 tsp of salt. Cook them for 4 whistles. Then switch off the stove, once the pressure is released, take out the roots, cut them into bite size pieces(2" cubes maybe...)
Heat oil in pan, splutter mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves followed by a pinch of hing. Add onion and fry for 2 minutes. Add red chili powder and turmeric powder, fry for another minute. Add the cubed tapioca, ginger & salt, give them a mix, be careful, tapioca shouldn't break. Once everything is mixed well, remove from the stove. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. It should be served when it is hot, it tastes better that way!

Puthina chutney @ Mint chutney

  • Fresh mint leaves - 1 whole bunch ( trim the leaves alone with tender stems)
  • Onion - 1 medium size, quartered
  • Red chilies or green chilies - 3 nos, halved
  • Split channa dal - 2 tbsp
  • Coconut - 2 tbsp (fresh or dry or frozen) (if you use dry, soak it in 3 tbsp of warm water for 5 minutes)
  • Ginger - 1" piece
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Tamarind paste - 1/2 tsp
For seasoning:
  • Vegetable oil/ghee - 3 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad dal - 1/4 tsp
Heat a tbsp of oil in a pan, fry the split channa dal for 30 seconds. Add onion and chilies, fry for a minute to 2. Then add mint leaves and fry for 2 minutes. Don't keep them in stove for more time. Switch off the heat, add the coconut. Let them cool.
Grind it in a mixer along with tamarind paste, salt and ginger. Make a smooth paste. Season it. It can be served with idli, dosa or even hot white rice.

• Rava - 1 cup(roasted)
  • Mixed vegetables - 2 cups ( carrot, beans, cauliflower, peas or any other veggies of your choice)
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, thinly sliced
  • Ghee/Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp
  • Curryleaves - 1 sprig
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Water - 2 cups
Heat ghee in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, add curry leaves followed by onions. Fry till onion becomes translucent. Add turmeric, coriander and red chili powder. Mix and fry for 1 minute. Add chopped tomatoes and vegetables. Mix well and fry for 3 minutes. Vegetables should be half cooked, now add 2 cups of water with salt and garam masala powder. Bring it to a rolling boil and add rava. Stir them well to avoid sticking for atleast 5 minutes. Rava should be well cooked now. Pour 2 tbsp of ghee on the top and serve hot.

Uthappam is our style pancake made of lentils and rice instead of flour. You can top it with what ever veggies you prefer. But most famous topping is onion, that makes it 'Onion Uthapaam'. We have it as a breakfast dish in India, but it can be very well eaten during lunch/dinner too. This is not crispy like dosa, but soft & spongy just like pancakes, so I call it as 'spicy rice pancakes' ;) It can be taken with chutney, sambar or even hummus too.

  • Dosa batter
  • Onion - 2 cups, finely chopped(preferably red ones)
  • Oil/Ghee - 1/2 cup

Heat your dosa pan, when it is hot enough pour a ladle of dosa batter, don't spread thin like we do for dosas. It should be little thick. Sprinkle the onions, you could see some holes on the top(see the picture) pour the ghee or oil on the top and in those holes. Cook the uthapam on one side for a minute. Flip it to the other side and cook for another minute. Keep the heat on med-medium high.

Do the same for other uthappams. Serve hot with your favorite chutney.

Egg dosa is one of our favorite breakfast dish from my mom's kitchen. Usually she makes this on weekdays... on everyday hurry morning(making lunch for us and packing our lunch box, cleaning... parallely settling morning quarrel between Saran and me, phewwwwwww wondering how could she managed us), in spite of all these, she was also making sure we take healthy breakfast. She wants us to have egg in our daily breakfast in any form. This is one her methods.

I follow the same here for us. Its definitely a time saving healthy breakfast.

  • Dosa batter
  • Eggs
  • Salt
  • Ground black pepper
Heat your dosa pan. If you pour batter in an unheated(not on enough heat), then you won't get crispy and golden brown dosa. So be sure your pan is hot enough. This is how I check if the pan is ready to start making dosa. Sprinkle few drops of water and let see if it is sizzling, thats the good sign :) Pour a ladle of batter on the pan and spread evenly in circular motion. Crackle an egg and pour it on the top of the dosa and spread evenly all over the dosa using a spatula. Sprinkle a pinch of salt and ground pepper as per your taste. Cover the pan and cook for a minute, then flip the dosa to the other side and cook for atleast 30 seconds to 1 minute. Now your egg dosa is ready!

This is one filling breakfast. Asparagus is a healthy green veggie, good source of folate. Its one of the veggies that shouldn't be avoided. To take asparagus often, we need variety of ways to cook, otherwise we'll get bored rt? So here is one of the ways I tried cooking asparagus...with eggs!

  For Omlette:
  • Egg - 3 nos
  • Milk - 1/4 cup
  • Butter - 1 tbsp
  • Red/White onion - 1 cup, finely chopped
  • Green onion - 1/2 cup, finely chopped
  • Red chili flakes - 1 tbsp ( as per your choice)
  • Salt - 1/4 tsp
Other Ingredients:
  • Asparagus - 1 bunch, washed
  • Ground pepper - 1 tbsp
  • Olive oil - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - 1/4 tsp
Take the upper half of the asparagus stems and pan fry them in olive oil, salt and pepper for 5 minutes on med heat.
In the mean time, beat the eggs with milk and other ingredients. Heat a pan, spray the oil, pour a ladle of egg mixture and make an omlette. Repeat the same for the remaining mixture. Now take an omlette, place 6 to 7 stems of asparagus at the center, spread some sour cream and wrap it. Egg and asparagus combo gives a sensational taste.

Here is a simple breakfast recipe. This is how Kartik makes French toast :)

  • Bread - 6 slices
  • Egg - 3 nos
  • Milk - 1/2 cup
  • Sugar - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1/4 tsp
  • Cinnamon powder - 1/4 tsp
Break your eggs and pour whites and yolks in a bowl. Add sugar, salt, milk and cinnamon powder. Beat well. Heat a pan, dip the bread slices one by one in the egg mixture and toast it in the pan on both sides. Serve hot with honey or syrup(optional.)

I go crazy for onion cashewnut pakoda (lets call it 'OCP' in short) from A2B(Adyar Aanandha Bavan.) When I went India last time, my MIL and her sisters made sure that OCP is available all time at our place. Or even when we go to others place, my MIL would takes a packet of OCP along with water bottles. After leaving our place, while driving she asks if I want to have it now... that was very sweet of her. After came back here, I seriously miss OCP with love from my mil :( That day I started craving for OCP. Ding!!!! instantly it clicked why don't we try making OCP. I called my mom and asked her recipe, I followed the same and this is what I got. It was yummy!
  • Gram flour - 2 cups
  • Rice flour - 2 tbsp
  • Baking soda - a pinch
  • Onion - 1, big size, finely sliced
  • Green chilies - 3 nos, thinly sliced
  • Fresh ginger - 2" piece, very thinly sliced
  • Fresh garlic - 2 pods, thinly sliced
  • Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp, chopped
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Cashewnut - 15 to 20 nuts
  • Water - 2 to 4 tbsp
  • Oil - 4 cups for deep frying
Soak nuts in warm water for 15 to 20 minutes. Mix gram flour and rice flour together, add salt, baking soda and mix well. Add onion, green chilies, garlic, ginger, coriander leaves, curry leaves to the flour mixture and combine them very well. Add the soaked nuts to the mixture, gradually sprinkle very little water and mix them well(you no need to finish the entire water I have mentioned). Make a thick batter, it shouldn't be watery. Heat oil in a frying pan, once oil is hot enough(put a very little piece of batter and see if it is sizzling up). Thats a good sign to start frying your pakodas. Take a spoon of onion batter and put it in the oil. Fry till it turns golden brown. Repeat the same for the rest. You can put as many spoons of mixture in the oil at a time as per the room available for frying in the pan. Well, it depends on the size of the pan you are using and amount of oil you poured. That's it serve hot with chutney, tomato ketchup...

A healthy Moroccan breakfast!!!

I make this dish atleast once a week. This is one fat-free breakfast dish, but if want you can always accompany this with hard boiled eggs. Cous cous is rich in fiber & protein with carbs and little iron. For those who want to have fat-free breakfast, then this is a must try recipe!

Very simple to make, no preparation time, only cooking time which maximum takes 6 minutes, definitely not more than that :)

  • Cous cous - 1 cup
  • Water - 3 cups
  • Peas - 1/2 cup
  • Corn - 1/2 cup
  • Cucumber - 1, peeled and sliced
  • Lemon juice - 2 tbsp
  • Olive oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - 1/4 tsp
  • Ground pepper - 1/4 tsp
  • Green chilies - 2nos, finely chopped (purely optional)
Bring 3 cups of water to a rolling boil, add cous cous. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring often. Add peas & corn with salt. Cook for 2 minutes(if its a frozen veggie, otherwise cook for 5 minutes)
Remove from heat, toss with olive oil, ground pepper and green chilies. Transfer it to the serving plate and pour the lemon juice. Garnish with sliced cucumber, it goes very well with broken hard boiled eggs.

Pancake is our all time favorite weekend breakfast. K makes chocolate pancakes(my favorite) for me in most of the weekends. So usually I get up from bed with the nice chocolate aroma of pancakes from our kitchen :) Here is our simple recipe for making chocolate pancakes.

  • All purpose flour - 3 cups
  • Eggs - 2
  • Baking soda - 1/2 tsp
  • Milk - 2 cups
  • Butter - 1 cup, melted
  • Chocolate chips - 1 cup
  • Sugar - 1 cup
  • Vanilla extract - 1 tsp
Beat eggs with sugar and butter. Add milk and beat them again. Mix soda with flour and gradually add egg mixture and beat them well without any lumps. Add vanilla extract and mix well. Pancake batter is ready. Heat your pan, pour the batter and spread lightly to a thick pancake. Sprinkle chocolate on the top, cook for 1 minute, flip to the other side and cook for a minute or 30 seconds. Cook on medium heat. Serve with your favorite syrup.

• Shrimp - 1 lb, washed and dried
  • Onion - 2 cups, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 2 cups, finely chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1 tbsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp

  • Fennel seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds and fennel seeds. Saute onion for 2 minutes. Add gg paste and fry for another 2 minutes. Now add tomatoes, red chili and turmeric powder. Tiramisu is a popular dessert. The name of this Italian dessert translates as "pick me up" which is said to derive from the fact that it is so good which literally makes you swoon as you eat it. There are many many versions of this recipe. It can be adapted to suit your own taste - you can vary the amount of mascarpone, lady fingers, coffee, rum, eggs...

  • Mascarpone cheese - 2 cups
  • Eggs - 3, separated
  • Sugar - 2 cups
  • Black coffee - 1 cup
  • Amaretto - 6 tsp
  • Lady fingers - 16 nos
  • Dark chocolate powder - 1/4 cup
  • Vanilla extract - 2 tsp
Put the egg whites in a bowl and whick them with an electric mixer until standing in stiff peaks. Keep them aside. Mix the mascarpone, sugar, vanilla extract, and egg yolks in a large bowl and whisk them until evenly combined. Now carefully fold in the egg whites. Don't beat them. Spread a layer of mascarpone mixute in the bottom of a large serving bowl. To the black coffee add the rum/amaretto. Dip the sponge lady fingers in the coffee mixture for 3 seconds. Place them on the mascarpone layer by keeping aside. Then spoon the mascarpone mixture over the spone fingers and spread evenly. Make more layers in the same way ending with a layer of mascarpone mixture. Level the surface, then sift dark chocolate powder all over. Cover the dish and chill overnight. Before serving sprinkle with more cocoa powder and grated chocolate (optional).

Take your baking dish, spary some olive oil, spread 1/2 cup of sauce, arrange 3 lasagna noodles lengthwise over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles. Top with baked eggplants, some sauce, some mozzarella cheese. Then again place the noodles like above and repeat the same above steps. Finally palce the final layer of noodles, spread the remaining sauce and mozzarella and parm cheese. Cover with the foil. Bake it preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes on 375F. Before taking out, remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes. Cool it for 15 minutes before serving.

Taking raw carrot is definitely good for health, no doubt in that. But what if you don't like its raw taste? Yes! This recipe is for those, just a few minutes fry adding nothing but salt. Even red chili is to give additional taste, that is quite optional. You can even reduce the oil too. Otherwise an easy recipe for daily cooking :)

  • Carrot - 3 cups, cut into 3" pieces
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp

Phool makahan is nothing but puffed lotus seeds. Lotus seeds are good source of Protien. In traditioanl Chinese medicine, lotus seeds are considered sweet & neutral. It tasted yummy & easy to cook than I thought it would be.

Khao pad is nothing but Thai fried rice. In Thai, 'Khao' means rice and 'pad' means fried. In Thailand, fried rice is a main lunch dish. Most popular one is the crab fried rice, I always order 'Khao pad poo' when I go thai restaurants, that is Crab fried rice in Thai :)

Mixture of fish sauce & soy sauce makes Thai fried rice unique from Chinese fried rice. And also other notable differences are they use brown rice & thai chili pepper for khao pad. When I cooked it for the first time, I didn't add Thai chili pepper. It gives more flavor if you add them.

  • Soy sauce - 2 tbsp
  • Fish sauce - 1 tsp
  • Lime - 1
  • Ground pepper - a pinch
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
Heat a heavy bottomed pan, when it is sizzling hot, add the oil and break the eggs to it. Scramble the your eggs, until it becomes little dry. Keep them aside. To the same pan, add the sauce and garlic, onions & tomatoes. Fry them well, add salt, cooked rice and eggs. Mix them all well. Dash some pepper. Garnish with green onion and serve hot with lime wedges at the side of the plate.

We both love Thai curries. I specially prefer green curry for its lemon grass flavor. I wanted to try Thai cuisine and browsed several websites but found this easy recipe from the label of 'Thai Kitchen Authentic' green curry paste. Pretty easy to make... I make Thai fried rice whenever I make this green curry. It goes well with plain brown rice too.

  • Coriander leaves – 2 tbsp, finely chopped

  • Coriander powder – 1/2 tsp

Khandvi is a typical Gujarati dish. It may look difficult to make, but its actually quite easy to prepare. Try it and let me know how it came out :)

  • Buttermilk - 1 cup
  • Besan Flour - 1/2 cup
  • Turmeric powder - 1/1 tsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
Seasoning:
  • Fresh coconut - 3 tbsp, grated
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tbsp
  • Sesame seeds - 1 tbsp
  • Green chilies - 5 nos, slitter
  • Oil - 4 tbsp
  • Coriander leaves - 2 sprigs
  • Hing - a pinch
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
1) Mix flour, turmeric powder, oil, salt & buttermilk together, beat well and form a batter. 2) Pour this in a heavy bottmed vessel and cook on a med-high heat by stirring continously. Do not let it to form lumps.   • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig

Serve it chilled.

This is very simple, quick & easy recipe. We usually make this pachadi for white rice. dosa with this pachadi is yummo.

When I run out of veggies, this is a quick fix!

1) Add 1tbsp of yogurt as soon as you add okra into the pan.This helps the stickiness to go away soon.

• Chicken - 2 lbs
  • Palak Leaves - 2 cups
