  • Salt - to taste
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam Masal Powder - 1/2 tsp
Heat oil in a kadai, splutter some mustard seeds, add GG paste(optional) and all the masala powders, cook in low flame, after 30 seconds add the vegetables and salt. Cover it and cook for 8 minutes. Not more than that. You are done. Serve hot :)

I knew only one way to cook shrimp(which was quite boring) until I came across this one. I got this recipe from Sanjay. He has been a good inspiration. Thanks to Vahrahvah Sanjay!

This is different and believe me, very very tasty.

  • Shrimp - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1 large, chopped
  • Tomato - 2 nos, chopped
  • Green chilies - 3 nos
  • Coriander leaves - 2 sprigs
  • Ginger Garlic paste - 1 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Pepper powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Whole Garam masala- few
  • Coconut - 1/2 cup, grated
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Red chilies - 2 nos
  • Salt - to taste
  • Vinegar - 2 tbsp
  • Sugar - a pinch
1) Soak cumin seeds, red chilies in vinegar for 10 minutes. Then make it a nice paste along with coconut, tomato, mustard seeds, 4 raw shrimps. 2) Heat oil in a pan, add the whole garam masala, fry for 30 seconds, then add chopped onion and saute till golden brown. 3) Then add turmeric powder, coriander powder & pepper powder and the above paste. Cook it in low med heat without adding water. 4) When raw smell goes, add water little by little, then add sugar followed by green chilies and shrimp. Cook until shrimp is done. 5) Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

• Chow chow - 1 cup, chopped in to 1" cubes
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1, chopped
  • Green Chilies - 2, slitted
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig, for garnishing
Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard and cumin seeds(if you have curry leaves add that too). Add onion & green chilies and saute for 2 minutes. Then add tomato, salt, all powder and cook for 1 more minute. Now add chow chow with little water, close the pan with lid and cook in low-med heat till raw smell goes. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti/rice.

This recipe seemed little weird to me for the first time. I still gave it a try. Believe me the taste was awesome!!! I got the recipe from chef Dhamodaran. I learned another way of cooking mushroom. Its an authentic chettinad dish & pretty easy.

  • Mushroom - 3 cups
  • Black Pepper - 1 tbsp
  • Channa dal - 1 tbsp
  • Red chilies - 1, dried
  • Tamarind Paste - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig, for garnishing
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
Roast channa dal, pepper, red chilies without adding oil. Let it cool. Then make a fine powder. Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds, add curry leaves & mushroom. Fry for few minutes. Add salt, saute again till mushroom shrinks. Now add the spice powder, mix it and fry for few more minutes. Then add tamarind paste. Cook for 1 min. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice & dal. Or even you can have it as it is.

I like potato cabbage combination. Kartik is not a big fan of potato and cabbage. Because for its nutritional value, I want him to take this both. No other go, I combined these together, so that I can make him eat these two in a single day.

  • Cabbage - 4 cups, shredded
  • Potato - 2, diced into 11/2 " cubes
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Green Chilies - 2 nos, sliced
  • Salt - to taste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 4 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad dal - 1/2 tsp
  • Ginger - 1/2 " piece, grated
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, fry your potato cubes. Keep it aside Heat oil in another pan, splutter some mustard seeds, urad dal, cumin seeds. Add onion, ginger & green chilies and saute for 1min, then add cabbage, salt & all masal powders. Close the pan and cook for few minutes, once you see cabbage is cooked well, go on and add cooked potatoes and mix. Cook for another minute. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, rice, etc...

One Friday we were invited for dinner to a friend's place. His mom had come from India... she wanted to make us some Bengali food. She made Aloo gobi, paratha, chole... wow all were AWESOME...

I desperately wanted to learn to cook north Indian dishes. Though I knew very dishes, they never came out that good. I have a few north Indian friends from whom I tried to get some tips on their style of cooking! I believe my dishes are getting better in taste!

Well, here is the recipe for Aloo gobi in Bengali style which I got from my friend's mom:

  • Cauliflower florets - 2 cups
  • Potato - 2 cups, diced into 2" pieces
  • Garam masala - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Black pepper powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 4 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig
  • Coriander powder - 1/2 tsp (optional)

Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, and fry the diced potatoes and let it cook.

Heat 1 tbsp oil in another pan and fry the cauliflower florets.

Keep them both aside. ( both are shallow fried )

Heat 2 tbsp oil and splutter some mustard seeds and cumin seeds.

Add garam masala powder, then add fried potatoes and cauliflowers.

Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, coriander powder & salt, shake well until all pieces are coated with masalas.

You are done, garnish with coriander leaves.

Serve hot with roti, rice, etc...

• Beetroot - 2 medium size, grated
  • Dried red chilies - 2
  • Ginger - 1/2" piece, grated
  • Coconut - 3 tbsp, grated
  • Coriander seeds - 2 tbsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
Seasoning:
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1/2 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Urad dal - 1/2 tsp
Heat a pan and dry fry the beetroot without adding oil for 2 minutes. Heat some oil in another pan, fry coriander seeds, cumin seeds, red chilies & coconut. Let it cool then grind it all together by adding salt. Season it with the seasoning ingredients. It goes well with rice, peas pulov, dosa...

• Rava - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1 cup, chopped
  • Red Chilies/green Chilies - 2 nos, chopped
  • Salt - to taste
  • Ghee - 3 tbsp
  • Water - 4 cups
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1/2 tbsp
  • Urad dal - 1/2 tbsp
  • Ginger - 1"piece, grated
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
1) Heat oil in a pan, roast the rava till it turns golden brown and keep it aside(if you have roasted rava, then skip this step). 2) Heat ghee in a pan and splutter some mustard seeds, followed by urad dal and channa dal 3) Add curry leaves, ginger, followed by onion and green chilies. Saute them for 1 minute. 4) Add 4 cups of water and salt, once it starts boiling, add roasted rava slowly stirring continuously on low-med heat. 5) Stir until rava gets cooked well. 6) Remove from stove. Pour some more ghee on top and garnish with coriander leaves. 7) Serve hot with white sugar, pickles, yogurt. In our place we serve Uppma with little white sugar. Thats the traditional way of serving Uppma. Otherwise I love to have it with any pickle, finally while finising we add yogurt to uppma!!!

• Pumpernickel bread slice
  • Hummus
  • Tomato - sliced
  • Onion - sliced
  • Cucumber - sliced
  • Butter
Butter the bread slices and toast it. Apply hummus on the bread and place your tomatoes, onion, cucumber and cover with another bread slice. Its good filling breakfast and its very good for health as it has rye and wheat flour as the main ingredients.

• Semiya - 2 cup
  • Onion - 1, big size, chopped
  • Tomato - 1,big size, chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1/2 tsp
  • Green Chilies - 4, sliced lengthwise
  • Coriander leaves - 1 sprig
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1 tsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1 tbsp
  • Urad dal - 1 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
Heat oil in a pan, fry the semiya till it turns golden brown color. (If you have roasted semiya, then skip this step). Keep it aside. Heat oil in another pan, splutter some mustard seeds, add channa, urad dal & curry leaves. Add onion, green chilies and saute for 2 minutes, followed by GG paste. Fry till raw smell from them goes. Add chopped tomatoes, salt, turmeric and garam masala powders and fry for 2 minutes. Add 4 cups of water. Once it starts boiling add your roasted semiya, cover the pan and cook for 5 minutes. Need to check and stir it occasionally or it would burn at the bottom. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with pickle, raitha, chutney, etc...

• Idli Rava - 3 cups
  • Yogurt - 3 cups
  • Carrot - 1 cup, grated
  • Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Green chilies - 3, finely chopped
  • ENO/baking soda - 1/2 tsp
  • Ginger - 1/2 " Grated
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp, you can prefer ghee too
  • Hing - a pinch
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1/2 tsp
  • Curry leaves - a sprig
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds, followed by cumin seeds, channa dal, curry leaves. Add hing, grated ginger, green chilies and fry for 1 minute. Add rava and roast it till it turns light golden color(do not roast it too much) Let it cool, then add yogurt, salt, carrot and mix well. Let it rest for 1 hour. Just before making idli add baking soda/ENO to the batter. Pour this batter into the oiled idli pan moulds, steam cook for 10 minutes. Serve hot with any chutney, sambar, kuruma,etc.

• Idli Rice - 3 cups
  • Urad dal - 3/4 cup
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 1/2 cup
Soak rice for 4 hours and dal for 1 hour. Grind it & add some salt, mix well and make the batter. Keep it in a warm place for atleast 8 hours(depends on the temp) so that it ferments. Fermentation is the good sign that your batter is ready to make idli/dosa. Heat paniyaaram pan, add few drops of oil in each pits and pour your batter, cook for 3 minutes on med heat. Flip them and cook the other side for 3 minutes. Serve hot with chutney, kuruma,etc.

• Egg - 4
  • Milk - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Black pepper powder - to taste
  • Red chili flakes - to taste
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Bell pepper - 1/2 cup, finely chopped
  • Cooking spray
  • Grated cheese - 2 tbsp (optional)
Beat the eggs in a bowl, add all the other ingredients and beat well. Heat your pan, spray some cooking oil, then pour the egg mix and cook for 1 minute at one side, turn it to the other, cook for another minute. Remove from pan and serve hot.

My mom used to make this for lunch when we were going to school. I hate to have roti with curries. She followed this recipe to make me eat rotis! Add different veggies for variety. Here I give the simpler version:

  • Chapati/roti/paratha – 4 nos, cut into 2″ pieces
  • Egg – 2 nos
  • Onion – 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato – 1 cup, chopped
  • Red Chili powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Garam Masala powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Green/Spring Onion – 1 cup, chopped
  • Oil – 2 tbsp
  • Salt – 1/4 tsp
  • Coriander leaves – 1 sprig
Directions:
  • Heat oil in a pan, then add onion, 1/2 cup green onions and saute for 1 minute.
  • Then add tomatoes, salt, all masala powders and saute for another 2 minutes.
  • Add eggs and mix well till it gets cooked, followed by chapati pieces.
  • Mix it well…remove from stove and garnish with coriander leaves & spring onions.
  • Serve hot with Raitha, kuruma
Note: If you have left over veg or chicken kuruma, add up to 1/2 cup to this dish, before adding chapati pieces. That gives restaurant kothu parota taste.

• Dosa batter
  • Carrot - 1 cup, grated
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, finely chopped
  • Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1, sliced
  • Oil/Ghee
Heat the tava/dosa kall on low/medium heat. In a separate skillet, heat oil & saute the onion,carrots. Keep it aside. Pour the dosa batter, add some carrots, tomato, onion, coriander leaves and pour 1 tbsp ghee on the top. Close the dosa and cook for about 1 minute. Flip it to the other side and cook for another minutes. Remove from tava. Repeat the same for uthapams. Serve hot with any chutney, sambar, kuruma Note:- You should maintain heat on warm while pouring the batter, once your poured increase it to med-high, cover and cook for 1 min. Flip it to the other side and reduce the heat to warm.

plain carrot uthaappam

• All purpose flour – 2 cups
  • Rava/Sooji – 2 tbsp
  • Yogurt – 1/2 cup
  • Salt – to taste
  • Yeast – 1 tsp
  • Sugar – 1/2 tsp
  • Warm Water – 1/2 cup / to knead the dough
  • Oil – for deep frying
  • Put yeast in warm water and add sugar, let it rest for 8 minutes.
  • Mix flour, rava and salt.
  • Add yogurt to the yeast mixture.
  • Gradually add yogurt-yeast mixture into the dry mixture and mix well. Start kneading to form a really smooth dough.
  • Keep this dough covered with paper towel in a warm place for at least 1 hour.
  • The dough should have doubled in size in 1 hour.
  • Oil your hands, divide your dough into 10 equal size balls.
  • Start rolling into your desired shape and deep fry it.
  • Serve hot with choley(the best side) or any sabji

• Bagel - 2
  • Sour Cream
  • Butter
  • Eggs
  • Salt & Pepper
  • Channa masala (or) any spread of your choice
Butter the bagel and toast it in a hot pan. Remove from the pan, apply some sour cream, top with your favorite veggie topping. For making simple scrambled eggs: Whisk eggs, salt & pepper and pour it on the hot pan. As it begins to set, gently using a spoon/spatula move across and sides of the pan. Softly stir it. Repeat it until all eggs are cooked well with no liquid egg.

• Wheat flour – 2 cups
  • Salt – 1/2 tsp
  • Oil – for deep frying
  • Warm water – 1/2 cup
Method:
  • Make a soft dough out of flour, salt, warm water, 2 tbsp oil.
  • Make small balls, roll it into a round layer(it should be little thick than you do for chapatis)
  • Heat oil in a pan, once the oil is hot, drop your poori and press the poori at the center gently with the spatula along the edges. It will start puffing up. After 20 secs, turn the poori to the other side and fry till light golden brown.Remove from oil.
  • Serve hot with Potato Masal or any sabji.

Fenugreek leaves stuffed paratha....  
  • Wheat Flour – 3 cups
  • Salt – ½ tsp
  • Methi leaves – 1 cup, frozen, if fresh you have to chop it finely.
  • Water – ¾ cup
  • Cumin seeds – 1 tsp
  • Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
  • Red chili powder – ½ tsp
  • Coriander powder – ½ tsp
  • Onion – 2 1 tbsp, finely chopped
  • Oil – 2 tbsp
  Method:
  • Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, let it splutter. add onion, fry for a while. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder and fry till raw smell goes. Add methi leaves and fry for a minute. Remove from stove.
  • Mix flour and salt, then add methi leaves mixture and oil. Start kneading with your fingers(add dry flour/water to get soft dough). Divide the dough into 6 equal parts and make soft balls.
  • As the tava gets hot (or just place it on a hot stove now), place the balls on a working surface and roll it with a rolling pin to make a soft layer.
  • Cook the paranthas in the tava in med-high heat on both sides for about 30 secs. Store it in an air tight container with paper towel. Serve hot with your favorite pickles/yogurt.

• Wheat Flour – 2 cups
  • Warm water – 1/2 cup
  • Potato – 1 cup, cooked and mashed
  • Peas – 1/2 cup, cooked and mashed
  • Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds – 1/2 tsp
  • Salt – to taste
  • Oil/Ghee – 1 cup
  • Garam masala powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Green Chilies – 1/2 tsp, finely chopped (or) use green chili paste
Method:
  • Make the dough using flour, salt and warm water.
  • Heat oil or ghee in a pan, splutter cumin seeds, then add green chilies/chili paste.
  • Add turmeric powder, garam masala powder, mashed potato and peas followed by salt. Mix them well. Switch off the stove.
  • Make golf ball size round out of the dough and roll it using a pin into a thick circular layer.
  • Make a small ball out from the aloo mix and place at the center of the dough layer, cover the aloo and make it a ball again. Dust with some dry flour if needed. Roll this into a flat circular layer.
  • Heat your pan, apply some ghee/oil then roast the stuffed dough until its done on one side, flip it to the other and roast again adding some ghee/oil.
  • Serve hot with raitha, dal, pickle or any sabji.

Dhokla is a Gujarati dish. We make Dhokla using 2 different ingredients. I used rava this time. Another type is rice + dals. I'll post rice-dal version soon. It is a good evening snack or a party appetizer. Sprinkle some grated coconuts over the dhokla(its upto you).

Ingredients for Yellow dhokla:
  • Rava - 1 cup
  • Besan - 2 tbsp
  • Fresh Curd - 1 cup
  • Water - if needed
  • Salt - to taste
  • Tumeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Fresh Lemon juice - 1 tbsp
  • Green Chili - 1, finely chopped
  • Ginger - 1", finely chopped
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Eno, fruit salt OR Baking soda - 1/2 tsp

Ingredients for green dhokla:
  • Rava - 1 cup
  • Besan - 2 tbsp
  • Fresh Curd - 1 cup
  • Water - if needed
  • Salt - to taste
  • Tumeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Fresh Lemon juice - 1 tbsp
  • Green Chili - 1, finely chopped
  • Ginger - 1", finely chopped
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Eno, fruit salt OR Baking soda - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - make a paste out of fresh coriander leaves, 3 tbsp of that paste
Seasoning:
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Sesame seeds - 1 tsp
Mix everything excep ENO or baking soda/powder, beat well and let it sit for 2 hours to 4 hours. This is a pretty simple recipe. A quick snack which can be made from the things you probably have at home all the time. It can be had anytime.

  • Bread - of your choice
  • Butter
  • Marinara sauce
  • Bell pepper - 1 cup, any color, chopped
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Shredded Cheese - 1/2 cup
Butter one side of your bread. On the other side, spread marinara sauce. Then add some cheese, some bell peppers & onion. Then top with some cheese. Place it in a baking sheet. Preheat your oven to 400F. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven, let it cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Ingredients for filling:

  • Mushroom - 2 cup, sliced
  • Spinach - 2 cup
  • Yellow Onion - 1, chopped
  • Garlic pods - 3
  • Salt - to taste
  • Butter - 1 tbsp
  • Cheese - 1/2 cup
Roux - recipe shown below For making Roux(bechamel sauce)
  • Butter - 1/2 cup
  • Milk - 2 cups
  • All purpose flour - 1/2 cup
  • Nutmeg - a pinch
  • Salt - 1/4 tsp
  • Pepper - 1/2 tsp
How to make Roux: Heat butter in a sauce pan, add flour, mix well and cook for 3 minutes until it turns golden brown color. Slowly add milk stirring continuously, without making any lumps. Add cheese roux, salt & pepper. Place 2 tbsp of this filling on the crepe and cover it into your desired shape. Serve hot.

• All purpose flour - 1 cup
  • Egg - 1
  • Milk - 11/2 cups
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Sugar - 1/4 tsp
  • Butter
Mix all the ingredients intto make a smooth batter. Let it rest for atleast 30 minutes. Heat your pan, butter it, pour 2 tbsps of batter swirl your pan to make crepe. Loosen the edges and check whether its cooked on that side. Flip it to the other side and cook. Remove from pan. Serve crepes with your favorite fillings.

I make channa masala often as it is one of Kartik's favorites. But it never tasted as good as one of my friends' dish. Although I followed the same recipe given by her, still I didn't get the taste. After several attempts, I learned the secret which is actually slow cooking. There are so many versions of chana masala recipe, but all have the same secret "slow cooking".

  • Channa - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1 large
  • Tomatoes - 2 large
  • Garlic - 3 cloves
  • Ginger - 1" piece
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Amchur powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Green Chilies - 2 chopped
  • Garam masala powder - 1 tsp
  • Tea bags - 2
  • Yogurt - 1/2 cup
  • Oil - 3 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Lemon Juice - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 2 sprigs
Soak channa overnight. Pressure cook it with tea bags. Make a paste of the ingredients from (2) to (8) Heat oil in the pan, add green chilies, then add the above paste, fry till the raw smell (if any) goes. If you hate big purple eggplants, try out this recipe and I bet you will love it!!!
Preparation is very simple, cooking may takes sometime, we need more cautious to avoid any charring.
I bought 2 big eggplants, I don't want to make any curry out of it.... actually I was lazy that time. So Begun Bhaja is the only easiest dish that can came to my mind. I cut all the eggplants and mixed with masalas. I fried some pieces and refrigerate the rest. When I cooked it on the next day, it tasted equally good. More the days better the taste.
Yep, thats the trick, you got to marinate as you do for fish or any other Veg 65. I do the marination on the same day I buy the eggplant. So whenever I want to have, I take out some pieces and fry it.

  • Eggplant - 1
  • Turmeric powder - 1 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1 tsp
  • Besan Flour - 1 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Yogurt - 2 tbsp
  • Oil - 1 cup for shallow frying
Cut the eggplant into 1/2" thick round slices Mix all the dry ingredients with yogurt Heat oil in a pan Coat the sliced eggplants with that mixture. When the oil is hot, shallow fry the eggplants. Add little more oil when it gets dry. Cook well on both sides and remove from the pan. It goes well with dal rice, Kichadi, white rice...

• Kovakkai(Tindora, Ivy Gourd) - 4 cups, sliced
  • Onion - 1 cup, finely chopped
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - /12 tsp
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
Heat oil in a kadai, splutter some mustard and cumin seeds. Saute onion and then add kovakaai, followed by spice powders and salt. Sprinkle some water, close and cook for 15 minutes on med heat. Serve hot with rice, rotis.

• Carrot - 2 cups, diced
  • Peas - 1 cup
  • Onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Green Chilies - 4 chopped
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Channa dal - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
Heat oil in a kadai and splutter some mustard seeds, followed by channa dal, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Then add onion, chilies. Once onion is fried well. Add diced carrots and peas, followed by turmeric powder and salt. Sprinkle some water, close the kadai and cook for 10 minutes on med heat. Serve hot with rice, rotis.

Brussel Sprouts with coconut - a perfect combintaion to please hard-nosed food critics. It goes well with hot rasam rice.

  • Brussels Sprouts - 4 cups, finely shredded
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Chana dal - 1 tbsp
  • Dry red chillies - 2 nos
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - a pinch
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Coconut - 1/2 cup, grated
Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds, then fry channa dal. Then add curry leaves and red chilies After that add turmeric powder and sprouts. Add required salt. Sprinkle some water and close it, cook in low to medium heat. Add the gated coconut and turn off the heat. Serve hot with rice + dal, curd, rasam...

• Pickled grape leaves - 10 nos
  • Long grain rice, rinsed - 2 cups
  • Parsley - 1 cup, chopped
  • Tomato - 1 cup, chopped
  • Dried mint - 1/2 tsp
  • Green onion - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Yellow onion - 1/4 cup, chopped
  • Cayenne pepper - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Lemon juice - 1/2 cup
  • Extra virgin Olive oil - 1 cup
  • Baby carrots - 10 nos
Mix all ingredients except grape leaves, 1/2 cup of lemon juice and 1/2 cup of olive oil. Spread open up the grape leaves. Stuff 1 tbsp of the mixture inside the grape leaves. Roll it up. For pizza base:

  • All purpose flour - 3 cups
  • Dry yeast - 1 tbsp
  • Sugar - ½ tbsp
  • Salt - ½ tbsp
  • Milk - ½ cup
  • Butter - ½ cup
  • Egg - 2 no (optional)
  • Warm water - 1/4 cup
For Topping:

To the warm water add dry yeast, sugar and salt. ( Water should be warm, neither hot nor cold). Keep it aside for 20 mins. Add eggs and butter to the milk and whisk well until all gets thoroughly mixed. Take flour in a wide mouth thick bottomed bowl, add yeast mixture and mix well, gradually add milk mixture and mix well. Now use your hands and start kneading the mixture for 20 mins to make a soft dough (add dry flour if it is sticky while kneading, even you can wet your hands with little oil.) After thorough kneading, cover the bowl with a soft cloth and keep the bowl in a warm place for at least 2 hours. After that you can see the dough doubled in size, knead the dough again( now its not sticky). Add the toppings, cheese all over the top, add left over pizza sauce on the top. Meanwhile preheat the oven for 400F for 30 minutes and place the stone in the top rack and bake them for 20 minutes. Remove from oven, let it rest for 30 minutes before serving.

Gulab Jaamun is a very popular dessert in India. It is made of dough which mainly contains milk products in a sugar syrup flavored with cardamom seeds. Most often eaten during festival times. Here is "from the scratch recipe" for Gulab Jaamun. But ready made flour (maida + milk kova) is also available in most of the Indian stores.That is pretty simple. This is one of trails!!!

For making Jaamun:
  • Milk - 1 gallon
  • Maida - 1 cup
  • Cardamom powder - 1 tsp
  • Milk - 3 tbsp
  • Oil - 4 cups for deep frying
For making syrup:
  • White Sugar - 2 cups
  • Water - 6 cups
  • Cardamom pods - 4 nos
For Garnishing:
  • Cashew nuts - 10 nos
How to make syrup: 1) Bring water to boil and add sugar and stir well to make a thin syrup. 2) Add cardamom pods and keep it aside. How to make jaamun: 1) Boil milk and make milk gova. Finally it must be thin so that if you add maida you could easily make dough. 2) Add cardamom powder and start making a soft dough by kneading with fingers. If you need add little milk drop by drop. 3) Heat oil in pan. Make small 1" round balls out of that dough. 4) Fry the balls in oil till it turns golden brown. 5) Put the fried jaamuns in the syrup we just made. 6) Let the jaamuns suck some syrup and let it puff. 7) Refrigerate and serve cold. 8) Serve with cashew nuts in the serving bowl.

  • Oil – 2 tbsp
  • Warm Water – 1 cup
Method: Add salt to the flour and mix them well. Now add warm water, mix well(add some dry flour/water if you need). Start kneading to make a soft dough. Divide the dough into 6 soft balls Heat the tava, place the ball on your working surface and start rolling with your rolling pin to a round thin layer. When tava is hot, start making chapatis. After 30 seconds, flip the chapati to cook on the other side. It will puff up. Press the sides with a thick paper towel/cloth. Store it in an airtight container. Serve with curry/gravy/sabji..

Its one of the favorite snacks in Tamilnadu. A must have in any feast! I'm sure you would have tasted it at some point some where. Here is how you can make it yourself. Enjoy!

  • Toor dal - 3 cups
  • Splitted channa dal – 1 cup
  • Dry red chilies - 5 nos
  • Fresh Green Chilies – 3 nos
  • Onion - ½ cup finely chopped
  • Garlic - 2 cloves, finely chopped
  • Coriander Leaves - ½ cup, finely chopped
  • Curry Leaves - 2 sprigs
  • Hing - a pinch
  • Salt - to taste
  • Vegetable Oil - 3 cups for deep frying
Method: Soak the dal in water for 5 hrs. Coarsely blend the dal with curry leaves, red chilies, green chilies, salt, hing and garlic. Add chopped onion and coriander leaves to them and mix them well with a spatula.
Heat oil in a frying pan. Make small balls from the paste, place it on the palm and press at the center of the ball lightly. Once the oil is hot, deep fry the vadai in the oil, turn to other side and fry until both sides turn golden brown. Remove from oil and place it on a paper towel to drain extra oil. Serve hot. Note: Do not make smooth paste out of the dal. It should be coarse, you should still feel the dal in the paste.

• Bell Pepper(Green and Yellow) - 2 nos, cut into small cubes
  • Sweet onion - 1/2 cup chopped
  • Olive Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Black Pepper - to taste
  • Parsley or basil leaves - 1/4 cup, chopped
  • Rice Vinegar - 1 tsp
Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hrs, bake for 15 minutes, toss the salad and serve. Adding little bit crumbled feta cheese before serving would add more taste :)

• Baby shell Pasta - 1 cup
  • Bell Peppers(any color) - 2 cups, chopped
  • Yellow Onion - 1/2 cup chopped
  • Carrot - 1/2 cup, chopped
  • Parmesan Cheese - 1/2 cup
  • Salt - to taste
  • Olive Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Black Pepper powder - 1 tbsp
Cook pasta as per the directions shown in the cover. In a large saucepan, add olive oil and saute peppers, carrots, onions. Add salt and cook for 10 minutes. Add pasta and parmesan cheese and ground black pepper. Serve hot.

1. Beetroots cooked water - 2 cups
  2. Tamarind paste - 2 tbsp
  3. Turmeric powder - 1 tsp
  4. Ghee - 1 tbsp
  5. Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  6. Red chilies - 2 nos
  7. Salt - to taste
  8. Cumin seeds - 2 tbsp
  9. Garlic - 2 cloves,crushed
  1. In a cooking pan, mix beetroot water, tamarind paste, salt,turmeric powder and let it boil.
  2. Meanwhile in a small frying pan, heat ghee and splutter mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
  3. Then add red chilies and garlic and fry for few mins.
  4. Add it to the beet water and mix well. Garnish with coriander leaves.
  5. Serve hot with rice.

Beetroot Raitha is simple to make & a delicious dish with hot white rice. It's color itself makes us feel hungry. Pachadi is one of the major dishes during festival feast. Beetroot pachadi always plays the top role.

Well, there are different ways to make pahcadi. Here is one of such versions. Use beaten yogurt or mixture of butter milk and yogurt :)

  1. Beetroot - 2 cups, chopped to bite size pieces
  2. Onion - 1 finely chopped
  3. Green Chilies - 3 nos, chopped
  4. Ginger - 1 tbsp, grated
  5. Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  6. Coriander leaves - 1 sprig
  7. Oil - 2 tbsp
  8. Ghee - 1 tbsp
  9. Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  10. Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  11. Salt - to taste
  12. Curd - 2 cups
  13. Asafoetida - a pinch
  1. Heat oil in a pan, splutter the mustard seeds followed by cumin seeds. Add onion, saute for 2 mins.
  2. Add green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, Asafoetida. Saute for 1 min. Then add beetroot and salt. Cook on med heat till beetroot is well done.
  3. Turn off the heat and let it cool. Then add curd and garnish with coriander leaves.
  4. Serve with hot rice, biriyani, pulov,etc.

• Cauliflower florets - 1 cup
  • Pasta of any kind - 1 cup
  • Milk (1% low fat would be good) - 1/2 cup
  • Garlic - 1 clove,crushed
  • Extra sharp cheddar cheese - 1/4 cup
  • Parmesan Cheese - 1/4 cup
  • Green Onion - 2 tbsp, chopped
  • Black Pepper - 1/4 tsp
  • White Bread - 1 slice
  • Butter - 1 tsp
  • Dijon mustard - 1 tsp
  • Water - 3 cups
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • All purpose flour - 2 tbsp
Preheat your oven to 400F. Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan, add cauliflower florets and 1/2 teaspoon salt and cook for 4 minutes. Remove cauliflower with a slotted spoon, reserving cooking liquid. Keep the florets aside. Bring cooking liquid to a rolling boil. Add pasta and cook for 7 minutes or until pasta cooked well, drain and set aside. Combine flour and milk in a saucepan, stirring well with a whisk. Add garlic and cook over medium heat until thick (about 8 minutes), stirring constantly. Remove from heat stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt, cheese, onions, mustard and pepper. Combine cauliflower, pasta and cheese sauce in a large bowl. Spoon the cauliflower mixture into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Place bread in food processor and make a coarse crumbs form to measure 1 cup.Combine breadcrumbs with butter sprinkle evenly over cauliflower mixture. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Let it cool down for 10 minutes before serving.

This is the basic and age old chutney. Being a local resource, available in plentiful, coconut is a staple ingredient in south Indian food. There is no better compliment than coconut chutney for dosa/idli/pongal or any other tiffin items, be it a bajji or any other snack. Make it in any color you want - add 2 sprigs coriander leaves to make it green or dry red chilies to make it red.

 
Coconut 1 cup, grated
Split channa dal 1/4 cup
Green Chilies 3 nos
Ginger 1/2 tsp grated
Garlic 1 pod, optional
Coriander leaves 1 sprig (optional)
Salt to taste
Seasoning
Oil 1 tbsp
Mustard seeds 1 tsp
Curry leaves 1 sprig
Blend all the ingredients together and make a smooth paste by adding little water. Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, add curry leaves and season your chutney. Serve with dosai, idli, uthapam, pongal, paniyaram...

• Custard Powder - 3 tbsp
  • Milk - 2 cups
  • Sugar - 1 cup
  • Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Cashew nuts - few nos
  • Dry grapes - 2 tbsp
  • Vanilla Essence - 1 tbsp (optional)
  • Fruits - 3 cups of mixed fruits, cut into bite size pieces.( apple, pears, papaya, chiko, pomegranate, guava, banana, grapes, strawberry, orange)
Add custard powder to cold milk and mix well without any lumps. Heat the milk by stirring occasionally. Add cardamom powder and sugar. Heat the milk for few more mins until it becomes creamy. Let it cool, then add fruits and refrigerate it for few hours before serving. Yummy fruit custard is ready.

• Blueberry - 1 cup, fresh/frozen
  • Sugar - 1/2 cup
  • Vanilla Icecream - 1/2 cup
  • Milk - 1 cup
Place all ingredients in the blender and blend them well. Serve it cold.

1. Beetroot - 1, large sized, chopped into bite size cubes
  2. Red Chilis - 2 nos
  3. Onion - 1/2 small, finely chopped
  4. Mustard seeds - 1/4 tsp
  5. Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  6. Split urad dal - 1/2 tsp
  7. Oil - 1 tbsp
  8. Grated Ginger - 1/2 tsp
  9. Grated coconut - 2 tbsp(optional)
  10. Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  11. Coriander leaves - 1 sprig
 
  1. Heat oil in a pan, splutter the mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Then add urad dal, curry leaves and red chilies. Then add onion and grated ginger. Saute for few minutes.
  2. Once raw smell from onion and ginger is gone, add the beets, salt and sprinkle some water. Cover the pan and cook for few more minutes.
  3. Add coconut before turning off the heat.
  4. Serve hot with rice.

• Brown Lentils - 1 cup
  • Onion - ½ cup, chopped
  • Dry red chilies - 3 nos
  • Turmeric powder - ½ tbsp
  • Garlic - 4 pods, finely chopped
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Fresh coriander - 1 sprig
Pressure cook the lentils by adding turmeric powder and salt. Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, then saute garlic, onion, curry leaves and red chilies for 2 minutes. Now add the cooked lentils and cook for 3 more minutes, garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot with Chapatis, white rice....

• Bell pepper(any color of your choice) - 3 numbers, chopped
  • Onion - 1 medium, finely chopped
  • Garlic - 3 pods, finely chopped
  • Red chili powder - 1 tsp
  • Gram flour - 2 tbsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Channa Dal - 1 tbsp
  • Urad Dal - ½ tsp
  • Hing powder - a pinch
  • Salt - to taste
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, let them splutter. The add cumin seeds, urad cal, channa dal. Followed by garlic and onion, saute for a minute. Then add chopped bell pepper, red chili powder and salt and cook for few minutes until raw smell goes. Roast the gram flour for few seconds and add very little water and make a thin paste. Once bell pepper is cooked, add this flour paste, mix well and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot with white rice, pulao, rotis.

• Fresh Coriander leaves - 2 cups, chopped
  • Onion - ½ cup, chopped
  • Green chilies - 2 nos
  • Tamarind paste - 2 tbsp
  • Coconut grated - 3 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Split Channa Dal (optional) - ½ tsp
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan and fry the onion. Then add green chilies and chopped coriander leaves. Saute them till raw smell goes, let it cool for a while. Add coconut, tamarind paste and salt and grind to a nice paste. In another pan heat oil and splutter mustard seeds and channa dal, season your chutney. Serve hot with idli, dosa, rice...

• Bitter gourd - 2 cups. Finely chopped
  • Onion - 1, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 1, finely chopped
  • Garlic - 7 pods
  • Red chili powder - ½ tbsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - ½ tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 5 tbsp
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Tamarind paste - 1 tbsp
Heat oil in a pan and fry the bitter gourd. Remove bitter gourd from the pan and keep aside. To the left over oil in the same pan, splutter mustard seeds and add onion, saute for 1 minute. Add garlic and fry for 1 minute, then add tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder and salt. Saute for 2 minutes. Add fried bitter guard, tamarind paste, mix them well, cover & cook for 10 more minutes. Remove from pan and serve with white rice.

Baingan bartha is a punjabi curry that goes well with roti/pulav.

  • Eggplant - 1 large sized
  • Onion - 1 large sized, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 2, finely chopped
  • Green Chili - 2 nos, finely chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - ½ tsp
  • Red chili powder - ½ tsp
  • Coriander powder - 2 tsp
  • Garam masala powder - 1 tsp
  • Cumin powder - ½ tsp
  • Turmeric powder - ½ tsp
  • Fresh Coriander leaves(cilantro)- 1/2 cup
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Sour Cream - 2 tbsp (optional)
  • Salt - to taste
  • Cooking Oil - 3 tbsp
Preheat the oven to its maximum temperature. Then oil the eggplant with a brush and bake for 30 minutes and finally broil for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, let it cool. Then peel off the skin(it will come easily). Smash the pulp and make a paste.(Trick – you can blend it in the blender too, but not more than 5 seconds) Heat oil in a pan, splutter some mustard seeds, then fry the onion till it turns golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and fry till the raw smell from the paste is gone. Add tomatoes and cook until its cooked well. Now add all powders, salt and fry for another 2 minutes. Then add eggplant pulp, add very little amount of water. Mix all well and cook for 5 minutes. Add sour cream & mix well. Remove from stove. Garnish with your favs. Serve hot with rotis/rice. [Note: Even you can use flame stove to roast eggplant. Be careful, don't burn your hands.]

• All purpose flour - 3 cups
  • Dry yeast - 1 tbsp
  • Sugar - ½ tbsp
  • Salt - ½ tbsp
  • Milk - ½ cup
  • Butter - ½ cup
  • Egg - 2 no (optional)
For the Toppings:
  • Grated Mozzerella cheese - 1 cup
  • Mushrooms - 1 cup, sliced
  • Green olives - 10 nos, sliced into lengthwise
  • Jalapeno - 3 nos, sliced lengthwise
  • Pizza sauce - ½ cup
  • Warm Water - ¼ cup
To the warm water add dry yeast, sugar and salt. (water should be warm, neither hot nor cold). Keep it aside for 20 minutes. Add eggs and butter to the milk and whisk well until all gets thoroughly mixed. Take flour in a wide bowl, add yeast mixture and mix well. Gradually add milk mixture and mix well. Now use your hands and start kneading the mixture for 20 minutes to make a soft dough (add dry flour if it is sticky while kneading, even you can wet your hands with little oil.) After thorough kneading, cover the bowl with a soft cloth and keep the bowl in a warm place for at least 2 hours. After that you can see the dough doubled in size, knead the dough again(now its not sticky) and use your rolling pin, make a circular layer of ½” thickness. Oil the pizza stone or any baking pan, place the dough over that. Apply a layer of pizza sauce, be generous while adding. Then add the topping, cheese all over the top. Add left over pizza sauce on the top. Preheat the oven for 400F for 20 minutes. Place the sheet in the top rack and bake it for 20 minutes. Let it cool for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

You don't need much here, only red chilies & salt. Others are purely opional!!!

  • Spinach - 2 cups, chopped
  • Onion - 2 tbsp onion, chopped
  • Red chili powder - 3 nos
  • Turmeric powder - ½ tsp
  • Mustard seeds - ½ tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 1 tbsp
Heat oil in a pan, splutter mustard seeds, then add onion and saute for 30 seconds. Add red chili, spinach, salt. Cook for 5 mins, spinach should be well cooked by now. Mash and mix well with a spatula. Serve hot with rice, idli + coconut chutney...

Spinach carrot rice is a healthy dish and easy to make. Add few grated coconut at the end if you like.

  • Spinach - 2 cups, chopped
  • Carrot - 1/2 cu, grated
  • Onion - 1 small sized, chopped
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cinnamon stick - 1, 2" length
  • Cloves - 3 nos
  • Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Plain rice - 2 cups, cooked
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  1. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, let it splutter. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon, cloves and fry for 20 seconds. Then add onion and saute for a minute.
  2. Add spinach, carrot, red chili powder and salt. Cook for few minutes until both spinach and carrot are cooked well. Then add rice, mix it well, cover and cook for 3 minutes.
  3. Serve hot with sour cream, pickle, raitha...

My perimma often makes this kuruma with dosa for dinner. oh we just love it, end up eating more dosais than usual. It goes well with idli/dosai and idiyappam. I haven't tried it with rice. Yummo kuruma recipe from my perimma Mrs.Banumathi Gounder.
  • Cauliflower - 1 cup, cut into small florets
  • Potato - 1 cup, cut into 1 ½” cubes
  • Green Chili - 3 nos
  • Coconut milk - 2 cups
  • Besan Powder - 1 tbsp(optional)
  • Cinnamon stick - 1 no
  • Cloves - 3 nos
  • Green Cardamom - 2 nos
  • Bay leaves - 3 nos
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp

Half cook the potatoes and cauliflower separately in boiling water.

Heat oil in a pan and add cinnamon stick, bay leaves, cloves, cardamom and saute it for 30 seconds. Add green chilies and saute for 1 minute. Now add half cooked cauliflower and potato and fry for 2 minutes. Add salt and coconut milk.

Cook for 3 minutes, don't let the coconut milk to boil, it'll destroy the taste. So be careful in that. If you want thick kurma, add besan powder and stir well before switch off the stove. Serve hot with dosa & idli.

Asparagus - a good source of Folate. Only the young shoots are edible. It doesn't have cholesteral and has very low sodium, hence considered as one of the healthy vegetables. I usually follow this same recipe for cooking Asparagus, which is simple to make. I'll post if I try any other new recipe from them.
  • Asparagus – 1 bunch, cut into 4” length
  • Pepper Powder – 1 tsp
  • Salt – to taste
  • Sugar – a pinch
  • Olive Oil – 1 tbsp
Heat olive oil in a pan and add asparagus. Add pepper powder, sugar and salt. Close with a lid and cook till it is done. Serve hot. (roasted asparagus served with spaghetti.)

• Tomatoes - 3 nos, chopped
  • Onion - 1 medium sized, chopped
  • Tamarind Paste - 1 tbsp
  • Red Chili - 3 nos
  • Ginger - 1” thick
  • Split Channa Dal - 2 tbsp
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Mustard seed - ½ tsp
  • Curry Leaves - 1 sprig
Heat oil in a pan, add channa dal and fry till it turns light brown color, then add red chilies, onion and ginger, fry it for 1 minute. Add tomato and fry for 2 more minutes, then switch off the stove. Let it cool, then grind to a fine paste. Heat oil in a pan and splutter mustard seeds curry leaves and season your chutney. Serve with Idli, Dosa, Uthapam, Paniyaaram....

• Moong Dal - ½ cup
  • Rice - 1 cup
  • Black pepper - 2 tbsp
  • Curry leaves - 1 sprig
  • Salt - to taste
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Ghee - 2 tbsp
  • Cashew-nut - 6 nos
  • Milk - 1 cup
  • Cumin Seeds - 1 tbsp
  1. Cook moong dal and rice in a pressure cooker with 50-50 milk and water and with salt.
  2. Heat oil in a pan, splutter cumin seeds, then fry cashew nuts. Switch off the pan and add black pepper and curry leaves in the same hot pan.
  3. Add this to the cooked rice and dal. Pour ghee over the top and mix well.
  4. Pongal is ready to serve with Sambar and Coconut Chutney.

I surprised myself when I tried this dish the first time. It really came out good giving me more confidence to try out new chicken recipes :)

  • Boneless chicken - 2 cups
  • Tomato - 2 big sized
  • Onion - 1 big sized
  • Green chiliy - 2 nos
  • Ginger Garlic paste - 1 tbsp
  • Red chiliy powder - 2 tbsp
  • Dhaniya powder - 2 tsp
  • Salt - to taste
  • Cashew nut - 10 nos
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Oil - ½ cup
  • Butter - 3 tbsp
Make a smooth paste of ginger garlic paste, 1tbsp of red chili powder, dhaniya powder & salt. Drop in the chicken pieces and make sure all the pieces are coated with the paste. Heat oil in a large pan and fry the chicken pieces. Keep the fried chicken aside. Now your pan still contains little hot oil. Throw the cumin seeds and let it splutter. Add onion and green chili, saute for 2 minutes or until it turns golden brown, add tomatoes and fry for 3 more minutes. Add cashewnuts, remaining red chiliy powder and salt and fry for 3 more minutes. Switch off the heat and let it cool down. Grind them to a smooth paste. Heat another pan. Add butter, once it melts, add the above ground paste and the fried chicken pieces. If the curry is too thick for your liking, you can add little water to suit your taste. Cook for 7 minutes for the above quantity. Serve hot with naan, rotis.

• Basmati Rice – 2 cups
  • Chicken – 11/2 lbs, cut into medium size pieces
  • Onion – 1, finely chopped
  • Onion paste - 1 cup
  • Ginger Garlic paste - 3 tbsp
  • Tomato – 3, chopped
  • Green chilly – 2 nos, cut crossed
  • Red chilli powder – 11/2 tbsp
  • Coriander powder – 2 tbsp
  • Oil – 3 tbsp
  • Cinnamon - 1 stick
  • Cloves – 6
  • Bay leaf – 2
  • Cardamom - 1
  • Sombu – 1 tsp
  • Mint leaves - 5 to 7 leaves
  1. Soak Basmati rice in water for 30 mins.
  2. Heat oil in a cooking vessel, add cinnamon, cloves, bay leaves, cardamom, sombu. Saute for 30 secs
  3. Then add ginger garlic paste, onion, onion paste, green chilly, mint leaves. Saute for 1 min or till the raw smell goes.
  4. Add tomatoes & fry for few mins. Then add all powders with salt. Cook for 3 mins.
  5. Now add the chicken and let it cook for 5 mins, or until half cooked
  6. Then add rice and water and let it cook.
  7. Serve hot with cucumber raithas, onion pachadi....

• Chicken - 2 cups
  • Onion - 1 large, finely chopped
  • Tomato - 2 large, finely chopped
  • Ginger Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp
  • Green chily - 2 nos, finely chopped
  • Red chiliy powder - 1 tbsp
  • Cinnamon sticks - 1
  • Cloves - 4 nos
  • Cardamom - 1 no
  • Bay leaves - 2 nos
  • Coriander powder - 1 sprig
  • Oil - 2 tbsp
  • Salt - to taste
Heat oil in a pan, add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves & bay leaves. Fry for 30 seconds, add chopped onion and fry till it turns almost golden brown, add ginger garlic paste. Fry them for 1 minute or till the raw smell from the paste is gone. Add chopped tomatoes,green chillies, red chili powder & salt. Saute until tomatoes are nicely cooked. Add the chicken pieces with ½ cup water, close with a lid and cook in medium/low heat for 15 minutes. Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with rotis, rice.

• All purpose flour – 3 cups
  • Warm water – ½ cup
  • Sugar – 1 tsp
  • Salt – 1 tsp
  • Milk – ¼ cup
  • Yeast – 1 tbsp
  • Oil – 3 tbsp
  • Butter – 2 tbsp
  Directions:
  • In warm water add yeast, then sugar and salt. Let the yeast sit in a warm place for 20 mins, till it raises up. In another bowl mix milk and butter. Mix butter mixture & yeast with flour and knead to a soft dough(add some dry flour if its sticky). Cover the bowl with a paper towel and keep it in a warm place for 2 hours.
  • After 2 hours you can see the dough doubled in size. Knead one more time and divide it into 6 equal parts. Preheat the oven to its max temp( 450F – 500F).
  • Make the balls into what ever shape you need with the thickness of ¼ inch, neither more nor less. Place it in a baking sheet and brush it with butter and keep it in the oven. Bake for 2 minutes on one side and then flop to the other side and let it cook for 1 ½ mins. Remove from oven.
  • Your naan is ready to serve with curry.
